Title: Junior Finance/Data Analyst
Description:
Fler is on a full-time mission to reshape the way consumer goods are perceived with the customer and the experience in focus. We are an innovative and fast-growing startup that wants to innovate the shaving and body-care industry and that loves to break today's standards.




We are currently looking for a Junior Finance / Data Analyst to support our financial planning and performance analysis efforts. In this role, you will transform raw data into valuable insights, helping the team make informed, fast decisions across the business landscape.




To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.




üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0


Tasks



Support the development of comprehensive monthly reports and detailed performance analysis, including but not limited to P&L, cash flow, and product margins, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in all financial documentation.


Organize, clean, and validate data gathered from various internal sources, and build insightful dashboards using tools such as Google Sheets, Excel, and Looker Studio to facilitate data-driven decision-making.


Analyze performance metrics across products, channels, and campaigns to identify trends and opportunities for optimization.


Contribute to the development of internal and investor reporting materials, ensuring clarity and precision in all communications.


Assist in translating complex bookkeeping data into actionable operational insights and accurate forecasts, aiding strategic planning.


Collaborate closely with marketing, retail, and product teams to support informed business decisions, leveraging financial insights to drive growth and efficiency.



Requirements



Degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field


Analytical thinker, strong with numbers and spreadsheets


Curious, tech-savvy, and eager to learn new tools


Detail-oriented, proactive, and organized


Hands-on self-starter comfortable with fast turnarounds


Bonus: familiarity with SQL, Google BigQuery, or data visualization tools



Benefits


Our philosophy is simple: we dream big, move fast and enhance each other's talents. As a brand, we are only as strong as the people who surround us. In this role you will:





Work on real business analysis from day one, with tangible impact


Collaborate across functions in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment


Join an incredible early-stage company where your decisions have immediate impact





To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.




üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0




If we believe there‚Äôs a potential match and your form meets our expectations, you will be contacted within 10 days for the next step of the process. We review every submission with care ‚Äî thank you for your time and interest in Fler!

Title: Data Analyst with Power BI
Description:
As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.

Key Responsibilities:


Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
Document analysis processes and calculation criteria



Required Technical Skills:


Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics



Preferred Technical Skills:


Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)



Soft Skills Required:


Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills



What We Offer:


Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
Contract and compensation based on experience



Why Choose FastCode:


The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
A young, international team environment
Training aligned with job-related activities
Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)



FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

Title: Insights and Analytics Internship (All Genders)
Description:
Insights & Analytics Intern

Milan, Italy

About The Job

Vuoi iniziare la tua carriera nel mondo HealthCare? Unisciti a Sanofi e avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di crescere e sviluppare le tue competenze sotto il coordinamento di stimolanti colleghi, contribuendo a fare la differenza nella vita di migliaia di persone in tutto il mondo. Come tirocinante nel team di Insights & Analytics, sarai coinvolto/a nell'implementazione di nuovi tool analitici su PowerBI, che hanno come obiettivo di monitorare e analizzare la performance (market, adoption, brand) attraverso definiti KPI aziendali. Collaborando con i colleghi di diverse funzioni, accrescerai le tue competenze analitiche e imparerai a lavorare con il metodo KANBAN, famigliarizzando con il mondo farmaceutico e le sue dinamiche e portando attivamente il tuo contributo e le tue idee.

Siamo un'azienda della salute, innovativa e globale, e siamo guidati da uno scopo: sfidare i confini della scienza per migliorare la vita delle persone. Lavorare in Sanofi significa appassionarsi al proprio lavoro, crescere di giorno in giorno esplorando tra innumerevoli opportunit√†, costruire stimolanti relazioni e superare i limiti di ci√≤ che pensavi fosse possibile. Ready to get started?

Le attivit√† che seguirai con il tuo team


sarai coinvolto/a in attivit√† di Project Management (PMO) a supporto del Insights & Analytics Pillar Head - Italy
supporterai i team di change management nell'organizzazione e nel coordinamento dei training da erogare ai colleghi e delle comunicazioni in merito all'utilizzo delle piattaforme
ti interfaccerai sia con i team locali sia con i team Global per la gestione e risoluzione delle segnalazioni e problematiche individuate
supporterai la generazioni di business insights e preparerai presentazioni su Power Point
contribuirai al processo di forecasting supportando i Business Analytics Lead
imparerai a utilizzare PowerBI


Chi cerchiamo


Laurea o laureando/a in Economia o Ingegneria gestionale;
Ottimo uso di Excel e Power Point;
Propensione per l'analisi e comprensione dei dati;
Organizzazione e interesse per il Project Management
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (livello B2 o superiore)
Gradita conoscenza di PowerBI


Perch√© Sanofi?


Dai vita ai miracoli della scienza entrando a far parte di un team coinvolgente e orientato al futuro
Inizia il tuo percorso professionale sotto il coordinamento di un tutor qualificato che stimoler√† la tua crescita professionale e ti aiuter√† a muovere i tuoi primi passi nel mondo del lavoro
Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di svolgere il tirocinio in modalit√† ibrida
Ti offriamo un‚Äôopportunit√† di tirocinio di 6 mesi. √à previsto un rimborso spese competitivo e buoni pasto


#EarlyTalent

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Il progresso non avviene senza le persone ‚Äì persone con background diversi, con origini diverse, con ruoli diversi, tutti uniti da un desiderio comune: far accadere i miracoli. Title: Planning Data Scientist
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Luigi Einaudi 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: Central Planning

Experience Required: At least 1 year preferred

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

Within the Demand and Supply planning function based in the HQ in Milan the role will have the responsibility of collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large sets of data, maintaining data flows and the data quality and provide the relevant and most reliable information to all related functions within the areas of Demand Planning and Inventory Planning.




Your Contribution:

Create and implement data models
Present visual data information
Synthesize data and information
Participate in multi-area AI projects in collaboration with other data scientists
Maintain and improve the Demand and Inventory Planning tools ensuring data quality and consistency
Secure reliable actionable databases for the Demand & Inventory Planners
Enrich the variety of data available to the team
Partner with other team members and managers in framing operational problems, conduct mathematical/statistical analysis of exiting operational processes, and validate data-driven solution alternatives.
Analyse and support Demand and Inventory planning processes and operations with the primary objective of increasing efficiency and effectiveness. Gather and process systematic data to support and define consistent and informative quantitative analysis.
Think of, develop, prepare and maintain relevant reports/dashboard/KPI‚Äôs/tools pertaining to Demand and Inventory planning processes
Develop prototype reporting and metrics that evaluate correctly Planning operations, S&OP flow and management system performance. Troubleshoot failures and handle questions and requests on existing reports.
Be the team's point of reference for all development activities of current tools and the introduction of new ones
Develop, support and maintain documentation and standard operating procedures




Your Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer data science (Big Data, Analytics and Machine Learning fundamentals) or related subjects
Statistical Knowledge
Data Wrangling
Programming Proficiency: knowledge of programming language like SQL, Python, R etc..
Knowledge of MS Access, Excel and database applications
Understanding business context
Experience with Business Intelligence reporting applications
Strong analytic skills, data mining and quantitative techniques;
Proven analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Excellent planning, organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Team building skills with positive attitude to collaboration
Flexible and approachable attitude
Strong organizational and presentation skills to effectively interact with all teams and business levels;
Excellent verbal and written in Italian and English;
Ability to learn quickly and to think creatively;
Proactivity and flexibility, driving sense of urgency;
Continuous improvement mindset;
Results-driven and goal-oriented person;
Experience in Management/Operational consulting and Fashion/Retail companies as a plus







Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Description:
Company Description

Publicis Groupe

Fondata nel 1926 da Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis Groupe √® oggi il primo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo. Presente in Italia con tre sedi - Milano, Torino e Roma - e oltre 1500 professionisti, il Gruppo agisce come partner strategico per la crescita dei propri clienti, offrendo un‚Äôampia gamma di competenze e soluzioni integrate nelle aree della creativit√†, media, produzione e business transformation.

Overview

La/Il Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare far√† parte del Team Buying e fornir√† supporto nella gestione dei dati di tutte le campagne media delle agenzie.

Responsibilities


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare grandi quantit√† di dati provenienti da diverse fonti (CRM, campagne digitali, social media, ecc.)
Supportare il team nella creazione di reportistica chiara e dettagliata per il monitoraggio delle performance
Collaborare con i team di marketing e comunicazione per fornire insight utili a migliorare le strategie di business
Utilizzare strumenti di data visualization (Power BI) per rappresentare i dati in modo efficace
Contribuire all‚Äôautomazione dei processi di raccolta e analisi dati
Mantenersi aggiornato sulle tecnologie e best practice di data analysis


Qualifications


Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini (in corso o appena conseguita)
Buona conoscenza di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati
Familiarit√† con strumenti di visualizzazione dati (Power BI)
Capacit√† analitiche e problem solving
Precisione, attenzione ai dettagli e capacit√† di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Interesse per il mondo del marketing e della comunicazione


Additional Information


Flessibilit√†: orari flessibili e smartworking;
Benefit aziendali: una piattaforma dedicata alle nostre persone, ricca di offerte, sconti e molto altro;
Formazione e Sviluppo: un percorso formativo su misura, un approccio individuale e basato sulle esigenze, sempre attivo!
Benessere aziendale: accesso gratuito a corsi online per il tuo benessere fisico e psicologico.

Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare
Description:
Descrizione dell'azienda

Publicis Groupe

Fondata nel 1926 da Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis Groupe √® oggi il primo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo. Presente in Italia con tre sedi - Milano, Torino e Roma - e oltre 1500 professionisti, il Gruppo agisce come partner strategico per la crescita dei propri clienti, offrendo un‚Äôampia gamma di competenze e soluzioni integrate nelle aree della creativit√†, media, produzione e business transformation.

Panoramica

La/Il Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare far√† parte del Team Buying e fornir√† supporto nella gestione dei dati di tutte le campagne media delle agenzie.

Responsabilit√†


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare grandi quantit√† di dati provenienti da diverse fonti (CRM, campagne digitali, social media, ecc.)
Supportare il team nella creazione di reportistica chiara e dettagliata per il monitoraggio delle performance
Collaborare con i team di marketing e comunicazione per fornire insight utili a migliorare le strategie di business
Utilizzare strumenti di data visualization (Power BI) per rappresentare i dati in modo efficace
Contribuire all‚Äôautomazione dei processi di raccolta e analisi dati
Mantenersi aggiornato sulle tecnologie e best practice di data analysis


Qualifiche


Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Informatica, Data Science o discipline affini (in corso o appena conseguita)
Buona conoscenza di Excel e strumenti di analisi dati
Familiarit√† con strumenti di visualizzazione dati (Power BI)
Capacit√† analitiche e problem solving
Precisione, attenzione ai dettagli e capacit√† di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Interesse per il mondo del marketing e della comunicazione


Informazioni aggiuntive


Flessibilit√†: orari flessibili e smartworking;
Benefit aziendali: una piattaforma dedicata alle nostre persone, ricca di offerte, sconti e molto altro;
Formazione e Sviluppo: un percorso formativo su misura, un approccio individuale e basato sulle esigenze, sempre attivo!
Benessere aziendale: accesso gratuito a corsi online per il tuo benessere fisico e psicologico.


Sapevi che il nostro motto √® "Viva la diff√©rence"? Con o senza D.Lgs. 198/2006, non vediamo l'ora di incontrarti e darti il benvenuto. Scopri di pi√π su Publicis Groupe Italia e sui nostri valori sulla nostra pagina ufficiale Instagram qui.

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
Description:
Chaberton Professionals, divisione di Chaberton Partners dedicata alla ricerca e selezione di profili di Middle Management, √® attualmente alla ricerca di un/una Junior Digital Analyst per un nostro importante cliente, publisher internazionale leader nel mondo dell'editoria e dell'intrattenimento.




Descrizione del lavoro:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Digital Analyst motivato/a da inserire nel nostro team Data & Strategy, che si occupa della strategia digitale del gruppo, lavorando con le redazioni, la gestione degli abbonamenti, del CRM e di una parte di attivit√† consumer.




Questa figura si dovr√† occupare delle audience digitali del gruppo, utilizzando tool di analisi avanzati per fornire insight strategici al team editoriale e all'azienda. Il ruolo prevede un lavoro di analisi continuo sui trend di traffico del gruppo, rispondendo alle esigenze sia dei team editoriali che aziendali, all'interno della pi√π ampia strategia digitale, andando ad affiancare un‚Äôaltra risorsa.

Sar√† cruciale la collaborazione con i team internazionali, con i quali si lavora stabilmente per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti, oltre che con altre realt√† esterne per la gestione di progetti locali.




Responsabilit√†:

- Monitorare le performance dei nostri siti web utilizzando strumenti come Google Analytics, Marfeel e Looker.

- Fornire insight e raccomandazioni basate sui dati per ottimizzare la strategia digitale.

- Analizzare i trend di traffico per rispondere alle esigenze dei team editoriali e aziendali e costruzione di forecast.

- Collaborare con il team tech e prodotto internazionale per migliorare la salute tecnica e SEO dei siti.

- Gestire e aggiornare la reportistica, sviluppando nuove analisi per supportare le redazioni e il marketing.

- Coordinarsi con i team internazionali per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti.

- Seguire lo sviluppo di nuovi eventuali progetti digitali seguendone le fasi di implementazioni con i relativi team operativi.




Requisiti minimi:

- 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli simili.

- Esperienza di 2 anni nell'uso di sistemi di analisi delle audience come Google Analytics o similari.

- Capacit√† di interpretare le richieste degli sviluppatori.

- Competenze SEO e conoscenza delle best practice tecniche per i siti web.

- Capacit√† di interpretare e comunicare dati complessi in modo chiaro e conciso.

- Esperienza nella collaborazione con team tecnici e internazionali.

- Competenze analitiche eccezionali e capacit√† di problem solving.

- Familiarit√† con Looker, Looker Studio, GSheet.




Qualifiche preferite:

- Esperienza nel settore editoriale o dell'intrattenimento.

- Esperienza con BigQuery.

- Eccellenti capacit√† comunicative e attitudine al lavoro di squadra.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Modalit√† di lavoro: ibrida

Title: BI & Data analyst
Description:
Alti Profili, divisione del Gruppo Umana specializzata nella ricerca e selezione di profili di middle management per il mercato italiano e internazionale, ricerca per conto di un‚Äôimportante realt√† multinazionale attiva nel settore della componentistica oleodinamica, parte di un gruppo con oltre 90 anni di storia e una presenza consolidata in pi√π di 15 Paesi, una/un:




BI & DATA ANALYST




La figura ricercata, che risponder√† direttamente al GROUP BI AND DATA ANALYTICS MANAGER, avr√† le seguenti mansioni:

Collaborare con gli stakeholder aziendali per raccogliere e analizzare i requisiti di business, traducendoli in soluzioni analitiche e tecniche efficaci;
Progettare, sviluppare e mantenere dashboard e report interattivi in Power BI, garantendo l‚Äôaccuratezza dei dati attraverso attivit√† di validazione e controllo qualit√†;
Analizzare trend, KPI e performance aziendali per supportare le decisioni strategiche e ottimizzare le attivit√† operative delle business unit;
Contribuire al miglioramento dei processi di data governance, assicurando qualit√†, tracciabilit√† e sicurezza del dato;
Aggiornarsi costantemente su strumenti e metodologie BI, proponendo soluzioni in linea con le best practice di settore.




La risorsa ideale si presenta con i seguenti requisiti:

Percorso di studi in ambito STEM, con priorit√† per candidati in possesso di laurea triennale o magistrale e con autonomia nell‚Äôutilizzo dell‚Äôinglese in contesti professionali;
Consolidata esperienza in ambito Business Intelligence, analisi dati e reporting, con capacit√† di analizzare KPI e produrre insight a supporto delle decisioni di business.
Buona conoscenza di Power BI per la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi; costituisce un plus la familiarit√† con strumenti analoghi come Tableau o Qlik e l‚Äôutilizzo di DAX.
Competenza nell‚Äôinterrogazione e gestione dei dati tramite SQL; verr√† data priorit√† a candidati con esperienza su fonti dati SAP e piattaforme Microsoft BI (es. SQL Server, Azure).
Conoscenza, anche di base, di data modelling, concetti ETL e principi di data governance.
Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e collaborazione con stakeholder tecnici e non tecnici, con attitudine alla traduzione dei requisiti di business in soluzioni analitiche efficaci.




Completano il profilo l‚Äôattitudine al lavoro in team, proattivit√† e interesse per l‚Äôaggiornamento continuo su strumenti e best practice di settore.




Luogo di Lavoro: Vimodrone (MI)




Inserimento con contratto a tempo indeterminato e offerta economica in linea con l‚Äôeffettiva seniority ed esperienza maturata.




Alti Profili √® una divisione di Umana S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro - Aut. Min. Lav. Prot n. 1181 ‚Äì SG del 13/12/2004. Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio √® rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77 e 125/91, D.lgs. 198/2006). Il trattamento dei dati personali dei candidati avverr√† nel rispetto della vigente normativa in materia di protezione dei dati personali.

La relativa informativa, resa ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679, √® consultabile al seguente indirizzo: http://www.altiprofili.it/privacynew.asp

Title: Data Analyst Marketing & Growth - Italy (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION


Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Analista di processo
Description:
Chi stiamo cercando?

Per la Digital Factory E-Health & Smart City stiamo ricercando la figura di analista di processo.

La figura selezionata seguir√† le attivit√† di clienti in ambito sanitario, con funzione SPOC tra i vari stakeholders.




Le attivit√† saranno legate a:

Attivit√† di analisi e nella mappatura dei processi clinico-sanitari;
Raccolta delle esigenze/requisiti del cliente e predisposizione della relativa documentazione;
Guidare i clienti nelle attivit√† di aggiornamento IT;
Assistere gli enti nelle comunicazioni interne ed esterne;
Fornire report e statistiche.




Requisiti:

Laurea Specialistica o Magistrale in ingegneria biomedica o informatica
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in progetti interni agli Enti Sanitari (CUP o Sistema Contabile/Amministrativo o Cartella Clinica Elettronica).
Capacit√† di Stesura documentazione di progetto: scenari di integrazione, checklist di validazione
Capacit√† di gestione della comunicazione e delle relazioni con Software House fornitrici e strutture aziendali di demand management
Conoscenza linguaggio xml
Conoscenze di Excel e SQL
Predisposizione e interesse per attivit√† di gestione risorse e progetti







Completano il profilo ottime capacit√† di comunicazione, teamwork, flessibilit√†, problem solving.







Sede assunzione: Milano

Cosa offriamo:

Tipologia contrattuale, RAL e inquadramento saranno valutati durante l‚Äôiter selettivo sulla base dell‚Äôesperienza maturata dal candidato prescelto.

Offriamo un ambiente dinamico, attento alle tue esigenze, piano di smart working post emergenziale, welfare aziendale e Flexible Benefit.




Cerchi la strada per esprimere al meglio le tue capacit√†, acquisire nuove esperienze, migliorarti nel confronto con persone dotate del tuo stesso entusiasmo e della tua voglia di crescere? Probabilmente l‚Äôhai trovata.




Chi siamo:

Il Gruppo Exprivia, specializzato in Information and Communication Technology (ICT), √® tra i principali protagonisti della trasformazione digitale sul mercato nazionale e internazionale con un team di esperti (oltre 2400 professionisti) in diversi ambiti della tecnologia e della digitalizzazione: dall‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale alla Cybersecurity, dai Big Data, al Cloud, dall'IoT al BPO, dal Mobile al Networking e alla Collaboration, presidiando interamente il mondo SAP.




Exprivia supporta i propri clienti nei settori Banking, Finance&Insurance, Aerospace&Defence, Energy&Utilities, Healthcare e Public Sector, Manufacturing&Distribution, Telco&Media.







Il Gruppo Exprivia √® presente in sei Paesi nel mondo (Italia, Spagna, Germania, Brasile, Messico e Cina) e presente in Italia a Milano, Roma, Trento, Vicenza, Lecce, Matera, Palermo e Molfetta dove √® basato l‚ÄôHQ.




La ricerca √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere.




Trattamento dei dati personali

Rispondendo al presente annuncio/email, la societ√† Exprivia S.p.a., nella sua qualit√† di Titolare del Trattamento, otterr√† i Suoi dati, definiti dal GDPR (regolamento UE 2016/679) "dati personali", esclusivamente per finalit√† relative alla ricerca e selezione del personale alle posizioni aperte attuali e future, per un potenziale inserimento all‚Äôinterno delle singole societ√† del Gruppo societario.

Exprivia Le ricorda che nel curriculum vanno indicati solo i dati necessari a valutare il profilo del candidato alla posizione a cui si √® candidato. I Suoi dati personali potranno essere comunicati anche alle altre societ√† del Gruppo che ne facciano richiesta per valutare un‚Äôeventuale assunzione in presenza di un interesse legittimo. Lei potr√† esercitare i suoi diritti privacy, compreso il diritto di opporsi alla comunicazione infragruppo, rivolgendosi al titolare o al DPO alle mail ufficio.privacy@exprivia.com o dpo_expriviaspa@exprivia.com.

Si prega di non inserire nel CV categorie particolari di dati personali gi√† noti come dati sensibili (relativi, in particolare, a salute, convinzioni religiose e opinioni politiche o sindacali). Eventuali dati sensibili indicati saranno immediatamente cancellati in mancanza del suo consenso che autorizzi Exprivia al loro trattamento. L‚Äôinformativa completa potr√† essere letta al seguente link https://www.exprivia.it/it/informativa-privacy-ai-candidati/‚Äù.

Title: Data & Research trainee
Description:
About SAMY

SAMY is a leading global social first agency. We activate end-to-end media strategies, connecting with audiences in the most integrated and effective ways to solve key business challenges and make brands matter.



We are the first international ecosystem fueled by creativity, technology and culture, and by a team of 900+ people across 20 offices and 55 markets, serving more than 270 leading clients, including Europe, the U.S. and Latin America, who live and breathe social-first. Together, we create relevancy in the social universe for blue-chip brands such as L‚ÄôOr√©al, The North Face, Diageo, Microsoft and Samsung, among others.



Our vision is to lead the evolution of brand communication. At our core, we are Bold, Human and Transformative. We are adventurous. SAMY is where your career pushes boundaries and unlocks your highest potential. We were born with a desire to go further. To defy the status quo. To reshape our world.



This is your opportunity to work around the globe. With exciting clients. In projects that shape the industry.



Mission


We are seeking a Data & Insights Insights Trainee to join our dynamic team in Milan. This role is critical in leveraging data to drive actionable insights, shaping innovative strategies, and optimizing campaign performance. The ideal candidate is proactive, eager to learn, analytical, curious, and skilled at uncovering trends that guide creative and strategic decision-making. Please note that for this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide regular reports on market and media data, delivering insights for both clients and the agency.


Monitor social media using relevant social listening tools


Conduct secondary research to provide broader context and deeper insights for clients and the agency.


Present findings to internal teams and clients.


Support the development of dashboards and databases to monitor and analyze client KPIs.


Provide technological support for clients.





Requirements


Academic Background: Market Research, Consumer Behavior, Social Media Analytics, Psychology, Quantitative Studies, or Similar studies.

Strong inclination to interpret data, visualize insights, and prepare reports.

Basic understanding of and interest in social listening tools like Sprinklr and Google Studio

Solid problem-solving and analytical skills.

Excellent communication and presentation skills (oral and written).

Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new tools and methodologies.

Proactive mindset with a willingness to master new insight tools and technologies.

Strong collaborative approach.

Genuine interest in research, data, human behavior and social media

High attention to detail in data analysis and report preparation.

C2 level in Italian and fluent in English is a must

Knowledge of SQL, or Python is a plus.

Social listening tools are a plus, specially Sprinklr

For this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university




Benefits


Hybrid work modality, 3 days in the office

Days off to be agreed with the manager

Dec 24 & 31 and your birthday off

Title: Analyst CS
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

NielsenIQ works with clients to provide insights, thought leadership to drive their business and grow their portfolios. Our work helps our clients set growth strategies and determines what products you ultimately see on the shelf. Our team members are experts across various categories and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients. Analysts within the Customer Success Team are responsible for the execution of projects with limited supervision by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations, and are expected to manage client relationships independently.

Responsibilities


Summarizes data in tables, charts, and graphs; analyzes and interprets sales data and consumer data + basic portfolio knowledge. Occasionally sets-up and refreshes cyclical reports
Prepares and delivers quantitative analysis and presentations (category overview as well as issue based) building a story and finalizing conclusions and proposes recommendations. Proposes calculation of Quantified Business Opportunity
Uses internal tools and data sources, coaching Interns and Juniors
Discusses advanced quantitative analysis design to best answer client questions with Client Business Partner/client with the support of senior team members, following and fully owning Center of Excellence (COE) ways of working process
Autonomously interacts with client staff both on basic client needs; leads client meetings and presentations over the phone and in person
Acts in line with the Service level of the client assigned
Catches sales opportunities at client meetings/during quantitative analysis and alerts CBP


Requirements


Native in Italian and Good in English Languages
Ideally 3 to 4 years as a quantitative Market Researcher, in a Research Agency (Ad hoc researches) strong client-facing and communication/presentation experience ‚Äì deliver research results to stakeholders on the client‚Äôs side in a clear, consistent manner
Good analytical skills, ability to interpret sales and consumer data
Ability to work in a Team within a dynamic environment
Good interpersonal skills
Organizational skills: understanding of business priorities; ability to adapt to complex and changing organization; ability to manage time schedules
Passionate in FMCG and client dynamics
Good project management skills, specifically for SPOC or Champion roles
Interested in financial and business environment of the clients and the industry
Full proficiency in PowerPoint & Excel


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Italian.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!




Work From Home - WFH - Remote - Freelance - Telecommuting - Flexible

Show more
HTML:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Italian.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.



Apply Online Today!


Work From Home - WFH - Remote - Freelance - Telecommuting - Flexible

Title: MPIM Analytics Intern
Description:
Job Description

Calling all originals: At Levi Strauss & Co., you can be yourself ‚Äî and be part of something bigger. We‚Äôre a company of people who like to forge our own path and leave the world better than we found it. Who believe that what makes us different makes us stronger. So add your voice. Make an impact. Find your fit ‚Äî and your future.

About The Job

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Italy for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

Are you excited to learn more about Supply Chain and the Fashion industry? About using your analytic and problem-solving skills to tackle real life data problems? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team, while working for one of one of the most iconic global apparel brands? If so, do not hesitate to apply!

Key Responsabilities


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe‚Äôs business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of ad-hoc analysis requests and to feed predictive modelling.
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You speak fluently English (any other EU language is a plus)
You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics/Economics and Business Management
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months, renewable.

This is a hybrid position based in our Milano office. You will be expected in office minimum 3 days per week. Time in office can vary depending on business needs.

LS&Co. is an affirmative action and equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and value people from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and experiences to make LS&Co. a collective success.

LOCATION

Milan, Italy

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Digital Data Analyst Specialist
Description:
Per supportare la nostra crescita, stiamo cercando un/una Digital Data Analyst Specialist da inserire nel Team Digital, una squadra giovane e dinamica che valorizza la proattivit√†, l‚Äôinnovazione e la voglia di crescere.

In Hippocrates Holding il contributo attivo √® sempre apprezzato: se hai idee e vuoi portare un contributo concreto, questo √® il posto giusto.

Ci impegniamo affinch√© ogni persona comprenda le dinamiche dei diversi business, partecipi alle decisioni strategiche e abbia chiara la propria importanza nel raggiungimento dei KPI.

Non lavoriamo a silos: promuoviamo collaborazione, crescita trasversale e curiosit√† verso tutti i reparti, facilitando lo sviluppo sia verticale che orizzontale.

Attivit√† principali:




Gestire in autonomia le attivit√† di digital analytics per monitorare e ottimizzare le performance delle piattaforme.
Mantenere e aggiornare i sistemi di tracciamento, collaborando con l‚Äôagenzia esterna per la gestione dei tag.
Supportare e interpretare le logiche di A/B testing per migliorare le performance digitali.
Creare e aggiornare dashboard e report in Looker Studio (e altri strumenti di reportistica) garantendo insight chiari e comprensibili.
Collaborare con i team interni che utilizzano Power BI per integrazioni e analisi avanzate.
Partecipare alla definizione dei KPI e fornire raccomandazioni data-driven per il business




Il/La Candidato/a ideale possiede:




Almeno 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in ambito digitale.
Ottima conoscenza degli strumenti di web analytics (Google Analytics, GA4).
Competenze avanzate in Looker Studio (principale strumento di reporting).
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di data visualization come Power BI (o similari).
Conoscenza approfondita degli strumenti di tag management (Google Tag Manager) e logiche di tracciamento.
Conoscenza delle metodologie di A/B testing.
Capacit√† di trasformare dati complessi in insight chiari per diversi stakeholder.
Attitudine proattiva, autonomia, curiosit√† e orientamento alla crescita.




Soft Skills




Flessibilit√† e spirito di adattamento a contesti in rapida evoluzione.
Capacit√† di organizzazione e gestione autonoma delle attivit√†.
Forte orientamento al risultato e al problem solving.
Propensione al teamwork e al dialogo cross-funzionale.
Pensiero analitico e attenzione al dettaglio.
Comunicazione chiara e capacit√† di trasformare insight tecnici in raccomandazioni operative per stakeholder non tecnici.




Cosa ti offriamo:




Un contesto dinamico e strutturato in forte crescita.
Opportunit√† di lavorare su progetti strategici a livello nazionale.
Collaborazione con team interni multidisciplinari e partner esterni di rilievo.
Percorso di crescita professionale e formazione continua.

Tipo di impiego: Full-time.

Title: Financial Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
We are looking for a brilliant and tech-savvy Financial Data Analyst Trainee to join our Milan HQ. The Financial Data Analyst Trainee will support the Manufacturing Controller Team team in ensuring accurate financial and operational data management through advanced reporting, dashboarding, and analytics. He/she will contribute to transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decisions.

Do you match this profile?


Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics and Big Data, possibly with Finance and Economics insights
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI; experience with ERP systems (SAP) is a strong plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a structured and data-driven mindset
Previous experience (or internship) in Finance, Data Analysis, or similar finance roles with strong exposure to data tools is a strong plus
Ability to manage large datasets and extract business insights through data visualization and storytelling
Proactive, detail-oriented, and eager to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Fluency in Italian and English (spoken and written).


If so, apply for this job!

What do we expect from you?


Contribute to the automation and digitalization of Controlling processes, improving efficiency and data accuracy through data modeling, automated reports and dashboard creation
Deliver ad hoc and structured analysis leveraging data science techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities.


The Recruitment Process


Apply online
If your profile matches our search, you will be contacted by our HR team for a first exploratory interview. Otherwise, you will receive an e-mail to inform you that we will not proceed with your application.
If the first interview turns out to be successful, you‚Äôll meet the Manufacturing Controlling Manager

Title: BNP Paribas Leasing Solutions Data Risk Analyst
Description:
POSITION: Data Risk Analyst

FUNCTION: Risk / Risk Management / Synthesis & Reporting

Mission

Actively manage the credit Risk for the BNP Paribas Leasing Solutions Italian portfolio, with specific focus on:


Credit Risk portfolio active monitoring
Bad Debt Charge reporting and forecast
Scoring systems development and monitoring


Role


Effectively provide all risk reports requested by Local and Corporate.
Monitor the performance of the portfolio against risk criteria to ensure that corrective actions are taken in case by the business lines.
Actively support monthly Risk Committee, keeping close relationship with Collection and Business Units teams
Develop, update and manage the Collective Impairment calculation on a quarterly basis
Ensure Provisions adequacy and validation of forecasting models, providing input to the financial planning process, with full ownership of Bad Debt Charge budget sessions; monitor performance and suggest adjustments as needed
Manage the relationship with the Corporate Risk Department, to ensure compliance with corporate needs and objectives
Implement and monitor risk analysis tools in order to support credit decisions at the application stage (i.e.: rating tool, Decision Making Models, etc..).


Skills


University degree in economic and/or quantitative matters (i.e.: Economy, Statistics, Engineering, etc..)
At least 3 years of professional experience in banking/financial sector, ideally in credit risk management environment
Knowledge of statistical tools development and management, and knowledge of credit risk concepts such as rating assignment, PD and LGD parameters
Good understanding of portfolio risk monitoring principles and tools, with knowledge on cost of risk modelling.
Good knowledge of Banking Regulatory aspects
Reliability to meet the commitments and performance expected, with organisational capacity and ability to prioritise and work within tight deadlines, to respond to issues as they arise, and to anticipate new ones.
Experience within the Italian Leasing market will be considered an advantage, but not a requirement.
Knowledge of English and/or French would be consider an advantage
Analytical skills
Excellent relational and transversal skills at all levels and with the business leaders (both local and Corporate).


This announcement is addressed to any gender (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunit√†)

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Chi siamo: Dils

Dils √® un gruppo internazionale leader nel real estate presente in Italia, Olanda e Portogallo e Spagna, protagonista del processo di trasformazione dell‚Äôintero settore attraverso le leve dell‚Äôinnovazione e della digitalizzazione. Con un team di oltre 600 professionisti e uffici a Milano, Roma, Amsterdam, Lisbona, Porto, Algarve, Barcellona, Madrid e molte altre citt√† in Spagna, Dils √® il punto di riferimento per imprese nazionali e multinazionali, investitori, operatori finanziari e privati per la ricerca e lo sviluppo delle migliori opportunit√† in ambito immobiliare nei settori Uffici, Retail, Logistica, Hospitality, Living & Residenziale. Il Gruppo si avvale anche di un Transformation Team interno, specializzato in Technology, IT, Marketing & Digital, Graphic Design, 3D visual e Research, con l‚Äôobiettivo di massimizzare la spinta al cambiamento dell‚Äôazienda.




Forte di una storia di oltre 50 anni nel mercato italiano con Redilco e Sigest, nel 2021 l‚ÄôAzienda cambia nome e diventa Dils. Dopo l‚Äôingresso in Olanda con Van Gool Elburg nel 2023, in Portogallo con Castelhana nel 2024 e in Spagna con Lucas Fox nel 2025, il Gruppo prosegue nel progetto di espansione europea per esportare la vision e il modello distintivo di business anche in Francia, Germania, Polonia e UK. Dils esprime la propria volont√† di innovare anche attraverso un nuovo modello di business basato sulla responsabilit√† sociale con un programma pluriennale di give back finalizzato a valorizzare e promuovere il territorio e le diverse identit√† che lo abitano.




Stiamo cercando un/a Research Analyst da inserire nel nostro ufficio di Milano nel Team Research.




Attivit√† Principali

Monitoraggio trend e dati delle principali asset class (Office, Logistics, Retail, Living, Hospitality, Alternative)
Supporto alla pubblicazioni e report di mercato per clienti e stakeholder
Approfondita analisi dei dati multidisciplinari (es: macroeconomiche, socio-demografiche, urbanistiche)
Supporto ai team interni con approfondimenti, dashboard e soluzioni analitiche su misura
Collaborazione con il network internazionale Research di Dils su progetti multicountry
Partecipazione allo sviluppo di strumenti digitali e insight tool innovativi




Requisiti

Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria, Statistica o campi affini
Capacit√† di analisi quantitativa e visualizzazione dei dati
Esperienza con Excel, PowerPoint e strumenti di presentazione
Ottime doti di comunicazione sia scritta che parlata, in italiano e in inglese
Conoscenza di Power BI o strumenti di business intelligence (plus)
Conoscenze di prompting AI e tool digitali innovativi (plus)
L'esperienza precedente nel settore real estate √® considerata un plus




Cosa puoi aspettarti unendoti a noi

L‚Äôopportunit√† di affiancare i migliori talenti e perseguire una carriera stimolante
Un respiro internazionale e la possibilit√† di lavorare con colleghi di altre nazionalit√† e culture
Sede di Lavoro a Milano, Piazza Diaz n. 7. Al 13¬∞ piano, la nostra Dils House, uno spazio ibrido in cui ci si incontra per una colazione o un pranzo tra colleghi, un break informale, un momento di ricarica di fronte al magnifico panorama sulla citt√†
Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefits




In Dils crediamo nel valore dell‚Äôinnovazione, guidata da tecnologia, dati ma soprattutto persone. Per questo vediamo la diversit√† in tutte le sue forme come una fonte di scambio e arricchimento e offriamo pari opportunit√† indipendentemente da etnia, colore, discendenza, religione, sesso, nazionalit√†, orientamento sessuale, et√†, cittadinanza, stato civile, disabilit√† o identit√† di genere.




Informativa Privacy

I vostri dati personali saranno trattati da Dils S.p.A, con sede in P.zza Armando Diaz, 7 ‚Äì 20123, Milano (MI), Italia. Ai sensi dell‚ÄôArticolo 24 del GDPR, i Contitolari definiscono congiuntamente le finalit√† ed i mezzi del trattamento dei dati personali. Per maggiori informazioni https://dils.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Mollie, we‚Äôre on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we‚Äôre a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe ‚Äì from Lisbon to London.

Your Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.

This role isn't just about technical expertise; it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.

What You‚Äôll Do


Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
Data analysis & interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.
Data visualisation & storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
Documentation & knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
Experimentation & prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.


What You Bring


Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python; experience with data modelling and automation
Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams
Business-aware, impact-driven, and curious
Show more

Title: Financial Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
We are looking for a brilliant and tech-savvy Financial Data Analyst Trainee to join our Milan HQ. The Financial Data Analyst Trainee will support the Manufacturing Controller Team team in ensuring accurate financial and operational data management through advanced reporting, dashboarding, and analytics. He/she will contribute to transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decisions.

Do you match this profile?


Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics and Big Data, possibly with Finance and Economics insights
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI; experience with ERP systems (SAP) is a strong plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a structured and data-driven mindset
Previous experience (or internship) in Finance, Data Analysis, or similar finance roles with strong exposure to data tools is a strong plus
Ability to manage large datasets and extract business insights through data visualization and storytelling
Proactive, detail-oriented, and eager to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Fluency in Italian and English (spoken and written).


If so, apply for this job!

What do we expect from you?


Contribute to the automation and digitalization of Controlling processes, improving efficiency and data accuracy through data modeling, automated reports and dashboard creation
Deliver ad hoc and structured analysis leveraging data science techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities.


The Recruitment Process


Apply online
If your profile matches our search, you will be contacted by our HR team for a first exploratory interview. Otherwise, you will receive an e-mail to inform you that we will not proceed with your application.
If the first interview turns out to be successful, you‚Äôll meet the Manufacturing Controlling Manager

Title: IT Specialist
Description:
TEHA Group √® un Gruppo professionale fondato nel 1965 che ha progressivamente sviluppato numerose attivit√† in Italia, in Europa e nel mondo.

Ricerca per i propri Clienti soluzioni professionali uniche ed efficaci di Consulenza Direzionale, di Aggiornamento Continuo, di Ricerca, di Summit, Workshop ed Forum, facendo leva sulla propria cultura europea in questa epoca di accelerazione, competizione globale e discontinuit√†.

A questi numeri si aggiungono circa 3.000 esperti nazionali ed internazionali che ogni anno vengono coinvolti nei 500 eventi realizzati per gli oltre 10.000 manager accompagnati nei loro percorsi di crescita.

La risorsa di IT Specialist si occuper√≤ della configurazione dei PC aziendali e della gestione, installazione e manutenzione dei dispositivi aziendali, garantendo l‚Äôefficienza e la sicurezza degli asset informatici. Sicurezza Informatica: Supportare l‚Äôimplementazione di policy di sicurezza (es. crittografia, antivirus, patching) e gestione delle autorizzazioni
Manutenzione: Monitoraggio dello stato dei PC, gestione di aggiornamenti software e hardware
Gestione delle Licenze: Amministrazione delle licenze software aziendali e rispetto delle policy aziendali
Documentazione: Supportare la redazione e aggiornamento di procedure, policy e manuali operativi per la configurazione e il supporto IT
Integrazione dell'Intelligenza Artificiale: Valutare e implementare soluzioni basate sull'AI (i.e copilot) per l'ottimizzazione della gestione IT, come il monitoraggio automatico delle prestazioni dei dispositivi e la risoluzione predittiva dei problemi
Lavorare a stretto contatto con tutti gli stakeholder aziendali

Contribuire alla documentazione tecnica e alla formazione

Limitare la raccolta di dati personali solo a ci√≤ che √® strettamente necessario (principio di minimizzazione dei dati).


Requisiti:

Il/La candidato/a ideale, con esperienza nel ruolo di 3-5 anni, √® in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

Sistemi Operativi & Software


Ottima conoscenza di Windows (client e server), macOS e idealmente anche Linux
Esperienza nella configurazione e gestione di software aziendali


Hardware e dispositivi


Installazione, diagnosi e manutenzione di PC, MAC, laptop, telefoni, stampanti, reti e smart device
Gestione inventario IT e asset tracking


Cybersecurity di base


Implementazione di policy di sicurezza
Competenze in crittografia, antivirus, patch management
Gestione autorizzazioni, accessi e utenti


Strumenti IT e automazione


Utilizzo di strumenti di Remote Desktop, Active Directory, software di deployment
Familiarit√† con sistemi di ticketing e monitoraggio
Nozioni di PowerShell o scripting base


AI e automazione:


Conoscenza di strumenti come ChatGPT, Copilot, Microsoft Intune, sistemi predittivi di AI support
Capacit√† di valutare e integrare tool AI-based per migliorare efficienza


Documentazioni e licenze:


Competenze nella gestione e controllo di licenze software
Redazione di manuali IT, policy e procedure


Competenze trasversali


Saper spiegare concetti tecnici in modo semplice agli utenti non tecnici
Capacit√† di prioritizzare richieste, rispettare scadenze e SLA
Atteggiamento proattivo, empatico e paziente
Diagnosi rapida dei problemi tecnici, approccio pratico
Capacit√† di analizzare, documentare e migliorare i processi IT


Extra (plus):


Certificazioni: CompTIA A+ / Microsoft Certified / ITIL / GDPR base / Agile Scrum
Esperienza con MDM (Mobile Device Management) o Microsoft Endpoint Manager


Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo:


Un contesto professionale in forte crescita, giovane e dinamico, caratterizzato dalla voglia di ‚Äúfar accadere le cose‚Äù.
Ottime prospettive di crescita professionale.

Title: Selezione unica per l'aggiornamento dell'elenco di idonei all‚Äôassunzione nel ruolo di Funzionario amministrativo contabile per la Provincia MB e gli Enti Convenzionati

  • Organizzazione, contrattualizzazione e vendita di nuovi prodotti e servizi nel settore del trasporto, stoccaggio e rigassificazione;
  • Gestione delle attivit√† per l‚Äôerogazione del servizio di default e di ultima istanza quali ad esempio la contrattualizzazione, la gestione delle garanzie, il monitoraggio dell‚Äôesposizione e le azioni a tutela del sistema;
  • Controllo dell‚Äôaccesso al bilanciamento commerciale e al servizio regolato di trasporto, stoccaggio e rigassificazione garantendo in particolare la verifica degli Utenti abilitati ed il monitoraggio dei livelli di esposizione del Sistema nei confronti degli Utenti.


Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto a tempo determinato in somministrazione. CCNL Energia e Petrolio. Inquadramento e retribuzione verranno valutate in fase di colloquio e saranno commisurate alla reale esperienza del candidato.
  • Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo: lavorerai in un contesto orientato a favorire lavoro di squadra, momenti di condivisione e innovazione.
  • Opportunit√† di crescita: attraverso i nostri programmi di crescita e formazione potrai sviluppare competenze tecniche e manageriali a contatto diretto con figure senior del settore; offriamo percorsi di carriera disegnati sulle tue ambizioni, con possibilit√† di specializzarti e far crescere il tuo potenziale.
  • Ambiente di lavoro giovane e dinamico: i team all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôazienda sono composti da persone consapevoli del valore aggiunto che pu√≤ portare ogni nuova idea ed ogni opinione; lavorerai in un contesto dove la tua voce conta davvero!
  • Iniziative per il tuo benessere: programmi di welfare aziendali che includono convenzioni sanitarie, supporto psicologico e nutrizionale, sconti su attivit√† e servizi e tanto altro per il tuo equilibrio psicofisico. Crediamo in un futuro dove efficienza, innovazione e benessere vanno di pari passo.
  • Smart working e flessibilit√†: crediamo nella sinergia e nell‚Äôinterazione che si crea lavorando insieme e sosteniamo il work-life balance attraverso politiche di lavoro agile, favorendo una gestione flessibile e responsabile delle attivit√†.


Requisiti

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale/Economia;
  • Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office, in particolare MS Excel e MS Access;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Interesse per il settore energetico/settore gas;
  • Predisposizione al lavoro in team, affidabilit√† e precisione.


Luogo di lavoro: Milano Sud

Orario di lavoro: Full Time da Luned√¨ a Venerd√¨.

Title: Data & Research trainee
Description:
About SAMY

SAMY is a leading global social first agency. We activate end-to-end media strategies, connecting with audiences in the most integrated and effective ways to solve key business challenges and make brands matter.



We are the first international ecosystem fueled by creativity, technology and culture, and by a team of 900+ people across 20 offices and 55 markets, serving more than 270 leading clients, including Europe, the U.S. and Latin America, who live and breathe social-first. Together, we create relevancy in the social universe for blue-chip brands such as L‚ÄôOr√©al, The North Face, Diageo, Microsoft and Samsung, among others.



Our vision is to lead the evolution of brand communication. At our core, we are Bold, Human and Transformative. We are adventurous. SAMY is where your career pushes boundaries and unlocks your highest potential. We were born with a desire to go further. To defy the status quo. To reshape our world.



This is your opportunity to work around the globe. With exciting clients. In projects that shape the industry.



Mission


We are seeking a Data & Insights Insights Trainee to join our dynamic team in Milan. This role is critical in leveraging data to drive actionable insights, shaping innovative strategies, and optimizing campaign performance. The ideal candidate is proactive, eager to learn, analytical, curious, and skilled at uncovering trends that guide creative and strategic decision-making. Please note that for this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide regular reports on market and media data, delivering insights for both clients and the agency.


Monitor social media using relevant social listening tools


Conduct secondary research to provide broader context and deeper insights for clients and the agency.


Present findings to internal teams and clients.


Support the development of dashboards and databases to monitor and analyze client KPIs.


Provide technological support for clients.





Requirements


Academic Background: Market Research, Consumer Behavior, Social Media Analytics, Psychology, Quantitative Studies, or Similar studies.

Strong inclination to interpret data, visualize insights, and prepare reports.

Basic understanding of and interest in social listening tools like Sprinklr and Google Studio

Solid problem-solving and analytical skills.

Excellent communication and presentation skills (oral and written).

Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new tools and methodologies.

Proactive mindset with a willingness to master new insight tools and technologies.

Strong collaborative approach.

Genuine interest in research, data, human behavior and social media

High attention to detail in data analysis and report preparation.

C2 level in Italian and fluent in English is a must

Knowledge of SQL, or Python is a plus.

Social listening tools are a plus, specially Sprinklr

For this traineeship you need to be enrolled at an Italian university




Benefits


Hybrid work modality, 3 days in the office

Days off to be agreed with the manager

Dec 24 & 31 and your birthday off
