Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




‚úÖ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




üîé The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




üí™ The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.




üí∞ The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




üìç Where you‚Äôll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




üéØ Ready to join Dataroots?

Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! üéâ

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll support our clients with their data quality needs:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




ABOUT US




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a team driving the energy transition and help build a sustainable, reliable, and green electricity system. Working alongside experts in market modelling and system adequacy, you‚Äôll contribute to key studies that shape the future of the energy grid and support Europe‚Äôs security of supply goals.




What you will do:

You‚Äôll be part of the Market Analysis team, contributing to a broader, forward-looking study required under European regulation to assess non-fossil flexibility needs for the next 5‚Äì10 years. Your tasks will include:

RES Integration Assessment: analyze curtailment and residual load statistics using economic dispatch results.
Ramping Needs Assessment: evaluate hourly ramping requirements and assess whether technologies can meet them.
Short-Term Flexibility Assessment: study system needs to cover unexpected demand/generation variations or outages.
Data Preparation & Reporting: ensure consistency across adequacy studies, outlooks, and flexibility indicators.
Methodology Development: implement regulatory requirements into concrete, quantified indicators.
Tooling & Automation: improve scripts and workflows in R/Python/Excel/VBA to process large datasets (10GB+).
Visualization & Communication: prepare clear visuals and statistics to present results to stakeholders.




What are we looking for?

You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant role.
Strong skills in R or Python (must have; both is a plus).
Experience with data handling, statistical analysis, and scripting.
Good command of Excel (must have); VBA is a plus.
Knowledge of economic dispatch tools such as ANTARES is an advantage.
Experience with electricity market modelling or flexibility studies is a plus.
Knowledge of and genuine interest in the energy market.
Analytical mindset with problem-solving and innovative thinking.
Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Passion for the energy transition and delivering high-quality tools.
Fluent in French or Dutch, plus fluent in English.




What do we offer?

Location: Hybrid

Contract: Freelance // 4 months

Start: September 1st 2025

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
At Phrase, we help open the door to global business by providing the world‚Äôs most comprehensive localization platform.

We‚Äôre transforming language technology with our AI platform to give people the content they need, in the language they speak. Whether it's for digital products like an app or website, marketing comms, legal literature, internal comms or customer service messaging, Phrase ensures that content always hits its mark by being on brand, consistent, and culturally resonant.

With a global team working from our offices in Hamburg and Prague‚Äîor from home across Europe, the UK, the US, and the APAC region‚Äîwe help organizations like Uber, Shopify, Puma, Snowflake, Volkswagen and thousands of others engage their customers at scale to accelerate growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Phrase, you will play a pivotal role in guiding product prioritization through data-driven insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers to implement analytics functionalities that empower our customers to make informed decisions. You will influence the development of data products for customers, participate in strategic discussions, respond to input from our customers to address their needs.Your work will be instrumental in bringing our Product vision to life and driving the success of Phrase's innovative localization solutions.




What you‚Äôll be responsible for:




Collaborate with Product Managers to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Develop and implement analytics functionalities within the Control Hub domain to support data-driven decision-making for customers.
Conduct detailed statistical analyses and data visualizations to inform product strategy and prioritization.
Manage competing priorities while navigating a high-context-switching environment.
Collaborate with customers to understand their data needs and gather feedback to help improve the product continuously.
Work closely with the BI/Data team and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and optimize analytics solutions.
Influence strategic decision-making by providing evidence-based insights and recommendations.




What you need:




Proven experience in analytical thinking and problem-solving within a product-oriented environment.
Proficiency in data visualization, statistical analysis, and SQL.
Hands-on experience with data tools and platforms commonly used for product analytics.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage competing priorities effectively.
A strategic mindset with a basic understanding of product management principles.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders across teams.
Experience in customer-facing roles or participating in customer calls is a plus.




What you‚Äôll get:




Work experience in a successful and growing global SaaS company
Be part of an international team of 300+ in Europe, APAC, and the Americas
Expert colleagues in their field who are determined to build the best localization platform on the market, creating a world where language never limits opportunity
An agile work environment, where it is encouraged to take smart risks
Take part in a culture full of trust, support and loyalty, where respectful and open feedback is valued, and diversity is fully embraced
A positive, open-minded, and innovative atmosphere
Support in your professional development and personal career goals




What's on top:




4 Company holidays additional to your regular holidays (1 day per quarter where the entire company is off to celebrate our achievements).
In addition, the company also provides employees with a Christmas break to allow you to spend time with family and friends without use of your vacation allocation.
Your birthday is off because it is important to celebrate you as well.
2 Giveback days where you can support the local community, volunteer, and/or participate in charity events and activities.
Professional and extensive onboarding.
Learning & development through Phrase learning and a dedicated ChatGPT Plus user license
Additional local benefits depending on the entity you're hired at, just ask your Talent Acquisition Partner




At Phrase we believe in the critical importance of diversity in all its forms and intersectionalities, and are committed to ensuring that the people we interview reflect this diversity. We therefore strongly encourage people of any identity to apply for our exciting career opportunities. We have taken an active decision to make our work environment inclusive every day, starting at the very beginning of your Phrase experience.

We value and welcome different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds as we believe that these differences make our team even stronger on our mission of opening the door to global business by giving everybody access to the content they need in the language they speak.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:

  • translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
  • collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
  • work in an agile team
  • act as the bridge between business and the developers
  • collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
  • prototype Power BI reports
  • evaluate results and help steer improvements
  • document processes, solutions and user guides
  • support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios

What You Bring To The Table

  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis,
  • 2+ years of experience working in agile teams
  • hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
  • experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
  • strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
  • analytical, independent and focused on solutions
  • customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
  • fluent in Dutch, French and English

Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:

  • a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
  • interesting training and career opportunities
  • group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
  • eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
  • concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
  • smartphone with subscription, internet fee
  • additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
  • discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)

Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more

Description Du Poste

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.


Your profile

We are looking for someone who :


Owns a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.Is eligible for security clearance.


Success in this role often comes down to :


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.


Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you‚Äôre passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Data analyst PowerBI & SAP BO (Freelance)
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Power BI Expert for our client in the financial sector. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights.

The consultant will work as a Power BI Expert within the Cash development team (6 people).

The overall project involves:


Migrating the data from the CashSSP datawarehouse to the cloud.
Converting a large number of static PDF reports (SAP BO) into Power BI reports that meet the same business requirements.



This new data warehouse will be leveraged by 12 European countries, making it a crucial tool for strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key Responsabilities

1. Coaching & Mentoring (50%)

You will dedicate approximately half of your time coaching and mentoring a team composed of IT developers and less experienced business users. Your role will be to guide them in improving their skills, adopting best practices, and deepening their understanding of Power BI data modeling and data visualization.

2. Data Modeling & Report Development (50%)

The remaining portion of your role will focus on:


Designing, implementing, and maintaining robust semantic models to support scalable, performant, consistent reporting including support for self-service analytics by business users.
Developing and optimizing Power BI reports and dashboards that deliver clear insights aligned with business requirements. Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the alignment of technical solutions with business objectives.



Required Skills & Qualifications

1. Coaching & BI Expertise


Proven experience as a Power BI Expert in a complex, enterprise environment.
Power BI certification is a strong asset.
Expertise in DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Desktop/Service.
Experience in creating paginated reports is a plus.
Strong communication and mentoring skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Team-oriented mindset and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms is preferred.
Knowledge of SAP BO to analyze existing reports is considered as a significant advantage



2. Semantic Modeling


Solid experience in data modeling, data transformation, and data integration.
Ability to design semantic layers that ensure data consistency and performance.
Knowledge of Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation in a multi-country, multi-user environment.
Understanding of different data connectivity modes (Import, DirectQuery, Live Connection) and when to use them.
Experience with Power BI deployment pipelines, workspace structuring, and lifecycle management.



3. Report Development


Strong understanding of data visualization best practices, including layout, user experience, and accessibility.
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful dashboards and visuals.
(Optional) Experience working directly with business stakeholders to gather and refine reporting needs.

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
A rapidly growing company is seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Power BI Expert to join the Business Intelligence team. In this role, you'll transform complex datasets into valuable insights and develop advanced Power BI solutions that empower data-driven decision-making. The position is based in Brussels.

Responsibilities

Power BI Development:

Create and manage advanced Power BI reports and dashboards, utilizing sophisticated DAX functions, calculations, and data models.
Optimize report performance for large datasets to ensure efficient data processing and visualization.
Implement security measures like row-level security to maintain data confidentiality.
Develop and maintain custom visuals and extensions to enhance reporting capabilities.

Data Analysis and Visualization:

Analyze diverse, large datasets to identify key trends and insights.
Design clear, impactful data visualizations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure accuracy and reliability.

Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:

Work closely with data engineers for seamless data processing and preparation.
Mentor junior analysts on Power BI best practices and advanced techniques.
Contribute to team knowledge-sharing initiatives and support collective growth.

Your Profile

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science or Statistics.
At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Power BI.
Experience working with complex data environments, such as data warehousing and big data.
Extensive knowledge of data modeling techniques, including star schema and dimensional modeling.

Technical Skills:

Expert in Power BI (both Desktop and Service), including advanced DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills and experience with various database systems.
Familiar with optimization techniques for Power BI reports and dashboards.
Knowledgeable in data security best practices within Power BI.

Personal Skills:

Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills for conveying data insights clearly.
Independent worker, but also a collaborative team player.
Passionate about continuous learning and data.

Bonus Points:

Experience with other data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Qlik Sense).
Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure or AWS).
Microsoft Power BI certification.

What We Offer

Permanent, full-time contract
Dynamic work environment within an innovative and fast-growing organization
Autonomy and entrepreneurship within your role
Results-oriented management with room for personal input
Competitive salary based on experience and responsibilities
Opportunities for professional and personal development

Are you ready for a new challenge in an inspiring environment? We look forward to your application!

HTML:
A rapidly growing company is seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Power BI Expert to join the Business Intelligence team. In this role, you'll transform complex datasets into valuable insights and develop advanced Power BI solutions that empower data-driven decision-making. The position is based in Brussels.

Responsibilities

Power BI Development:

  • Create and manage advanced Power BI reports and dashboards, utilizing sophisticated DAX functions, calculations, and data models.
  • Optimize report performance for large datasets to ensure efficient data processing and visualization.
  • Implement security measures like row-level security to maintain data confidentiality.
  • Develop and maintain custom visuals and extensions to enhance reporting capabilities.

Data Analysis and Visualization:

  • Analyze diverse, large datasets to identify key trends and insights.
  • Design clear, impactful data visualizations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
  • Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure accuracy and reliability.

Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:

  • Work closely with data engineers for seamless data processing and preparation.
  • Mentor junior analysts on Power BI best practices and advanced techniques.
  • Contribute to team knowledge-sharing initiatives and support collective growth.

Your Profile

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science or Statistics.
  • At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong focus on Power BI.
  • Experience working with complex data environments, such as data warehousing and big data.
  • Extensive knowledge of data modeling techniques, including star schema and dimensional modeling.

Technical Skills:

  • Expert in Power BI (both Desktop and Service), including advanced DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with various database systems.
  • Familiar with optimization techniques for Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Knowledgeable in data security best practices within Power BI.

Personal Skills:

  • Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills for conveying data insights clearly.
  • Independent worker, but also a collaborative team player.
  • Passionate about continuous learning and data.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with other data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Qlik Sense).
  • Familiarity with programming languages like Python or R.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure or AWS).
  • Microsoft Power BI certification.

What We Offer

  • Permanent, full-time contract
  • Dynamic work environment within an innovative and fast-growing organization
  • Autonomy and entrepreneurship within your role
  • Results-oriented management with room for personal input
  • Competitive salary based on experience and responsibilities
  • Opportunities for professional and personal development

Are you ready for a new challenge in an inspiring environment? We look forward to your application!

Title: Ecommerce Data Analyst
Description:
Tired of inheriting someone else‚Äôs messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way?




We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Ecommerce Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling DTC team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.




If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that‚Äôs hungry for your expertise.




YOUR MISSION

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.




This is a full-time, contractor role.




WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU

Architect the company‚Äôs entire BI stack and define best practices from day one
Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, Checkout champ, Phone Apps, and more
Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth
Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING

Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch
Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance
Work with large datasets and create custom AI bots
Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights
Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions
Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance
Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders
Work cross-functionally with teams across marketing, tech, and leadership to improve data visibility and measurement




WHO YOU ARE

Experience: 3+ years in ecommerce data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles with exposure to data infrastructure and performance reporting
Builder Mentality: You‚Äôve worked in (or thrive in) low-data-maturity environments and know how to get results without perfect tools
Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data
Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms
Analytical & Strategic: You connect the dots across funnel stages, ROI metrics, and ad performance to guide decision-making
Self-Starter: Comfortable working independently and building systems from the ground up in a fast-paced environment
Collaborative Partner: Skilled at working across departments and aligning data initiatives with company objectives
Software Background: Bonus if you have a foundation in software engineering to collaborate more effectively with developers




RECRUITMENT PROCESS

Intro Chat: A quick intro call to understand your experience and motivations
Tech Interview: Deep dive into your technical abilities and past experience
Task: A small, real-world BI task to see how you think and communicate
Final Chat: We‚Äôll align expectations, goals, and finalize the next steps

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist ‚Äì Breng data tot leven en maak impact




Kontich | Internationale werkomgeving | Fulltime (40u/week) | Hybride werken mogelijk




Ben jij gebeten door data en klaar om je BI-skills in te zetten in een snelgroeiende organisatie die bouwt aan de infrastructuur van morgen? In deze functie werk je mee aan slimme rapportering en diepgaande analyses die businessbeslissingen rechtstreeks be√Ønvloeden. Je krijgt de ruimte om zelfstandig projecten uit te bouwen en je expertise verder te verdiepen met de nieuwste technologie√´n.




Deze sterk groeiende speler is actief in de uitrol, modernisering en ondersteuning digitale infrastructuur in Belgi√´. Met meer dan 1.000 medewerkers in de Benelux en een geschatte jaaromzet van meer dan ‚Ç¨200 miljoen, levert de organisatie cruciale diensten voor verschillende bedrijven en diensten.




Je komt terecht in een hecht team waar je ownership krijgt over je werk, maar ook omringd wordt door collega‚Äôs met kennis van zaken. Variatie, vrijheid en impact gegarandeerd.




Data Analist - Jouw verantwoordelijkheden




Ontwikkelen en beheren van dashboards, analyses en rapporteringen in Power BI
Bouwen aan een centrale dataroom en integraties realiseren met andere systemen
Vertalen van businessdoelstellingen naar KPI‚Äôs en procesverbeteringen op basis van data
Zelfstandig beheren van BI-projecten met ondersteuning van een ervaren team
Waken over datakwaliteit en voorzien van betrouwbare inzichten voor de organisatie




Data Analist - Jouw profiel




Minstens 4 jaar ervaring in een BI- of data-analysefunctie
Grondige kennis van Power BI, DAX, M Query, datamodellering en ETL-processen
Ervaring met Python en Notebooks is een plus
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en gestructureerde projectaanpak
Zeer goede kennis van Nederlands en Engels; Frans is een troef




Data Analist - Wat mag je verwachten




Een voltijdse functie binnen een innovatieve en dynamische organisatie
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met onder andere:
Bedrijfswagen met tankkaart
Maaltijdcheques, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
Ecocheques
20 verlofdagen en 12 ADV-dagen
Opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden via een interne academy
Een professionele en informele werksfeer
Flexibele werkuren en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
Variatie, autonomie en ruimte voor initiatief

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Job Description

We are moving towards an increasingly data-driven world, with boundless possibilities. At Telenet, Data & analytics‚ÄØare recognized as‚ÄØthe fuel & engine under the hood that can improve everything in our business. Within the Data Acceleration Tribe - the centralized data & analytics team in Telenet‚Äôs agile at-scale organization - our Data Strategists play a key role in shaping and executing our AI products.

Our Data Strategists are centralized and report into our Analytics & AI team. They play a key role in our so-called ‚ÄòBoost‚Äô concept, with each individual data strategist leading the execution of one of our AI products and steering the day to day efforts of our data scientists and analysts to do so. This happens in close collaboration with business teams across Telenet (quarterly click-in mechanism with business teams) on topics such as Customer Experience transformation, Segment-of-one marketing, Value-based network roll-out, and Strategic workforce intelligence.

As a group, data strategists collaborate closely with our organization‚Äôs business - and data leadership to ensure that the work we do in data delivers value.

Your Key Roles & Responsibilities


You drive the execution of AI products to turn our data strategy into reality in close collaboration with business stakeholders, taking a leading role towards your fellow data colleagues in the topic
You provide direction by bringing clarity on WHAT the team needs to deliver and WHY this has to happen in specific macro use cases
You support topic identification and prioritization of use cases, i.e. you work closely with business leaders to identify and prioritize problems that can be solved through data & analytics
You proactively drive prioritization, ensure alignment and manage expectations with all involved stakeholders, including business stakeholder and data leadership
You proactively support, challenge, and inspire business teams by broadening their perspective and showing the possibilities that exist in the world of data
You make sure that we invest our data resources wisely and to the greatest benefit of Telenet


Your profile


You have strong business and leadership skills
A sharp understanding of how data can be used to drive the business.
Strong storyteller skills and the ability to deliver a message with impact.
Excellent negotiating and influencing skills to deal with conflicting priorities and ambiguity.
Ability to lead a group of your data colleagues (2-4) on a day to day basis to collaborate with business teams in delivering value from data
A strong background management consulting is a (big) plus, with valued skillset incl. slide writing, business cases, prioritization, project management, stakeholder management, written communication and presentation skills (pyramid principle)
You have a can-do mentality, an agile mindset and experience with dealing with change in an organization.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.
You have a Master or equal by experience, and 5-10 years relevant experience.


How we make a difference for you!

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of our data driven organization, where we work in the utmost flexible way, be it from home or from our open and trendy collaboration spots at the office, and collegiality is more than just a word. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We‚Äôll coach you, train you and make you part of our story. Moreover, you‚Äôll enjoy a wages and benefits package that will get you places. We‚Äôre talking meal vouchers, group and health insurance, a yearly bonus and discounts on Telenet products. Come experience it for yourself, our passion is contagious.
Show more

Title: Business & Data Analyst Healthcare
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

HR Rail zoekt nieuwe collega's, Wil jij onze teams versterken? Ontdek de vacature hieronder en solliciteer.

Opmerking

Bedankt om te solliciteren via deze link.

Wat is jouw rol bij HR Rail?

Het team Project & IT Management (PIT) van de KGV is op zoek naar een Business & Data Analyst Healthcare om het team te versterken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie en het beheer van diverse projecten op het gebied van digitalisering van de geneeskundige verzorging.


Als Business & Data Analist Healthcare werk je mee aan de digitalisering van de sector geneeskundige verzorging door deel te nemen aan verschillende werkgroepen en commissies. Je stelt business requirements op voor de IT-afdeling en analyseert de impact en behoeften voor de back-office.
Je houdt toezicht op tests die worden uitgevoerd met softwarepakketten van prestatieverleners.
Je identificeert en test de door IT voorgestelde oplossingen en aanpassingen en stelt na akkoord het programma in productie. Nadien verzorg je de follow-up.
Je volgt voortdurend de ontwikkeling op het gebied van regelgeving op die binnen de KGV ge√Ømplementeerd moet worden en je analyseert de impact van deze wijzigingen in regelgeving op lopende projecten.
Je beheert individueel een breed scala aan projecten en bent specialist in je domein in samenwerking met de expert en co√∂rdinator van het team.
Je analyseert vragen en problemen , zoekt antwoorden en identificeert het onderliggend probleem met het oog op het implementeren van een oplossing op korte, middellange en lange termijn.
Je bent back-up voor je directe collega's in geval van afwezigheid (opvolging FMB‚Äôs, projectopvolging, deelname aan vergaderingen en feedback aan collega‚Äôs).


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma of gelijkwaardig door ervaring als Business & Data Analyst (minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de materie)
Je hebt een eerste relevante ervaring als Business & Data Analyst
Professionele ervaring binnen een verzekeringsinstelling (mutualiteit) of het domein gezondheidszorg is een plus.


Technische Competenties


Je kan vlot werken met de MS-Office toepassingen, voornamelijk met Word en Excel.
Je beheerst het Nederlands perfect, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling en je hebt een gevorderde kennis van het Frans (niveau B2).


Gedragscompetenties


Informatie analyseren: je bekijkt informatie vanuit een kritisch standpunt en aanvaardt informatie niet zonder er verder over na te denken.
Opvolging verzekeren: je volgt met een gepaste frequentie acties op en stuurt bij in functie van de te bereiken objectieven.
Oplossingen implementeren: je neemt het initiatief om oplossingen aan te reiken, ook in onbekende situaties. Je neemt concrete acties om problemen op te lossen en vooruit te gaan.
Continu leren: Je plant en beheert je eigen groei actief en stelt het eigen functioneren kritisch in vraag. Je verwerft continu nieuwe inzichten, vaardigheden en kennis.
Communiceren: je brengt een boodschap of gegevens op een duidelijke, correcte en transparante manier over, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling, in functie van het doel en het publiek.
Regels & procedures toepassen: Je werkt nauwkeurig en respecteert de procedures en regels.


HR Rail wil dat de sociale diversiteit weerspiegeld wordt in zijn medewerkers. Het zijn je talenten en enthousiasme die tellen, niet je geslacht, leeftijd, afkomst of handicap.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?


Een contractuele betrekking in een innovatief en dynamisch bedrijf.
Een interessante functie met de mogelijkheid om initiatieven en verantwoordelijkheden te nemen en waarin je de kans krijgt om jouw kennis en vaardigheden te ontwikkelen en uit te breiden.
Extra legale voordelen (hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, enz.).
Variabele werkuren en na je opleiding mogelijkheid tot 3 dagen telewerk.
Een treinabonnement 1ste klas op het volledige Belgische netwerk.


Waar ga je werken?

HR Rail, een naamloze vennootschap van publiek recht, is de

HR-dienstverlener en juridische werkgever van alle medewerkers van de Belgische spoorwegen.

HR Rail is een samenwerkingsplek waar de klant altijd op de eerste plaats komt, waar we verantwoordelijkheid nemen en waar we bij elke procedure en elk project voortdurend de mogelijke effici√´ntie verbeteren. Dit zijn onze waarden en ons DNA, onze CORE: samenwerking, klantgerichtheid, verantwoordelijkheid en effici√´ntie.

Binnen HR Rail is de dienst Care4Rail verantwoordelijk voor het medisch-maatschappelijk beleid van de Belgische spoorwegen. Het omvat de Kas der geneeskundige verzorging (KGV), de verzekeringsinstelling van het statutaire personeel van de Belgische Spoorwegen, voor wat betreft de verplichte verzekering voor geneeskundige verzorging.

Het managementteam en het team voor project- en IT-management van de KGV zijn gevestigd in Brussel.

De regionale teams staan in voor het rechtstreeks contact met de aangeslotenen en zorgen voor de praktische uitvoering van de regelgeving rond geneeskundige verzorging, zoals het toekennen van rechten, terugbetalingen en toelatingen.

De facturatie en de contacten met zorgverleners worden centraal opgevolgd door een gespecialiseerd team in Brussel.

Jouw werkplek is gelegen vlakbij het station in Brussel (station Brussel-Zuid).

What‚Äôs next ?


Stel je kandidaat via deze link: https://jobs.infrabel.be/HRRail/job/BrusselBruxelles-Business-&-Data-Analyst-Healthcare/826262702/


De inschrijvingen worden gesloten zodra wij voldoende aantal kandidaturen hebben ontvangen.


Als je na screening van jouw cv en sollicitatiebrief voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, wordt je gevraagd niet-eliminerende redeneertesten af te leggen en een online persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst in te vullen.


HR Rail behoudt zich het recht voor het aantal sollicitanten te beperken tot de profielen die het best bij de functiebeschrijving passen.


Vervolgens word je uitgenodigd voor een online interview waarin jouw belangstelling voor de functie en jouw vaardigheden en ervaring nader worden beoordeeld. Dit selectiegesprek wordt voorafgegaan door een case-study.
Als jij de kandidaat bent die wij zoeken, moet je ons nog enkele documenten bezorgen (je diploma, strafblad, ...).
Klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Title: Data Analyst Forensic Investigations
Description:
Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world?¬†You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory ‚Äì Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Locations: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:
As a Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.


Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
Degree¬† business engineer,¬† economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English

Your chance:

Best-in-class continuing education at Deloitte University as well as within the framework of individual qualification offers and training courses
Comprehensive development opportunities through structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation as well as promotion of social commitment and corporate volunteering
Work-life balance thanks to mobile working & part-time, sabbaticals and family services, e.g. to support family caregivers, parental leave counselling and much more
Focus on health and fitness through regular health days, cooperation with fitness providers and support for sports and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bike and car leasing, company smartphone for private use and flexible working models such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working
Diverse creative freedom and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture - including through our Diversity & Inclusion employee networks
Our Risk, Regulatory & Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.



Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:



My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities


Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte


Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte


Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte


Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:



Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).


Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

HTML:
Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory ‚Äì Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Locations: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:
As a Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
  • Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
  • Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
  • Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
  • Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
  • Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.

Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
  • Degree  business engineer,  economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
  • Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
  • Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
  • High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
  • Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
  • Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company‚Äôs data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least‚Ä¶ a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover‚Ä¶ üòâ


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

31-07-2025

Title: Technical Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Technical Analyst to support the ongoing development and maintenance of the CWM (Client Wealth Management) platform. This role is essential for driving technical evolution, resolving performance issues, and ensuring seamless communication between frontend and backend systems.

You will work closely with development teams and external partners to define technical requirements, guide implementation, and support testing activities. Conduct technical analyses for new features and platform improvements. Document clear and actionable instructions for development teams. Investigate and resolve performance issues and communication gaps between frontend and backend.

Support the development of new features, including replacing outdated modules (e.g., digital signing within investment flows). Perform unit testing and validate data flows using tools like Postman and SQL.

Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure alignment and smooth delivery.

Monitor and support daily operations of the CWM platform, including bug tracking and issue resolution. Participate in planning and roadmap creation for upcoming technical initiatives.

Requirements

The technical analyst must have experience with the following technologies - Java, Angular, SQL

very important: webservices (YAML, WSDL...)
Show more
HTML:
We are seeking a Technical Analyst to support the ongoing development and maintenance of the CWM (Client Wealth Management) platform. This role is essential for driving technical evolution, resolving performance issues, and ensuring seamless communication between frontend and backend systems.

You will work closely with development teams and external partners to define technical requirements, guide implementation, and support testing activities. Conduct technical analyses for new features and platform improvements. Document clear and actionable instructions for development teams. Investigate and resolve performance issues and communication gaps between frontend and backend.

Support the development of new features, including replacing outdated modules (e.g., digital signing within investment flows). Perform unit testing and validate data flows using tools like Postman and SQL.

Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure alignment and smooth delivery.

Monitor and support daily operations of the CWM platform, including bug tracking and issue resolution. Participate in planning and roadmap creation for upcoming technical initiatives.

Requirements

The technical analyst must have experience with the following technologies - Java, Angular, SQL

very important: webservices (YAML, WSDL...)

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards ‚Äì it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact ‚Äì all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems‚Ä¶)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers ‚Äì 02 370 30 62 ‚Äì erwin.verniers@external.equans.com ‚Äì https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers
