Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G‚Äôs supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
Location: Brussels - Hybrid (2 days remote/week after training)

Duration: Full-time, long-term contract

Tech Stack: Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Stream/Log Analytics, Azure DevOps, SQL Server, Python, Power BI, Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, Apache Arrow




About the Role

We‚Äôre seeking a talented Freelance Data Engineer to join a dynamic Data & Digital team, shaping a cutting-edge Data Platform that powers strategic business goals, innovation, and transformation. You‚Äôll work in agile product teams to design and deliver data pipelines, storage structures, materialized views, and data exchange endpoints, while collaborating closely with business stakeholders to drive impactful solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

‚úî Pipeline Development. Build and optimize data pipelines using Azure services (Databricks, Data Factory, Functions, Stream/Log Analytics) and Python in a Databricks environment.

‚úî Data Architecture: Design efficient storage structures and materialized views for analytical technologies.

‚úî Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with business analysts to refine requirements and present reusable, integrated solutions.

‚úî Testing & DevOps: Contribute to extensive solution testing and reinforce DevOps practices within the team.

‚úî Documentation: Create clear, structured documentation for data models, pipelines, and processes.

‚úî Governance Support: Engage with data governance tools (Glossary, Modeling, Lineage, Data Quality) to ensure compliance and quality.

‚úî Continuous Learning: Stay open to exploring new technologies like Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, or Apache Arrow.




Ideal Candidate Profile

‚úÖ 3‚Äì5+ years of hands-on experience in **2 of the following**:

- SQL Server

- Azure services (Databricks, Data Factory, Functions, Stream/Log Analytics, DevOps)

- Python-based data pipelines/enrichments in Databricks

- Power BI reporting

‚úÖ Openness to learning new technologies (e.g., Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, Apache Arrow).

‚úÖ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on iterative, transversal data solutions.

‚úÖ Customer-oriented, product-focused mindset with excellent communication skills.

‚úÖ Team player who thrives in a collaborative, agile environment.

‚úÖ Fluent in **English** (mandatory); proficiency in French, Dutch, or German is a plus.

‚úÖ Experience in the energy sector is a bonus!

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You‚Äôll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let‚Äôs meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular ‚ÄúGuild‚Äù workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances‚Ä¶
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Officer, Future Surveillance and Control systems
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

31-Aug-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

7,970.25

Grade

NATO Grade G17-G20


SUMMARY



The NATO Office of Resources (NOR) provides independent and integrated expert advice to the Secretary General, NATO Resource Committees, Allies, and other stakeholders on the planning, allocation and utilisation of military common funding made available to achieve NATO‚Äôs goals and objectives.

The NOR advice is based on sound judgement underpinned by facts, figures expertise and knowledge. It follows NATO policies, procedures and standards, and is independent of external stakeholder‚Äôs viewpoints. It supports efficient and effective use of public funds by assessing the policy compliance, eligibility, affordability, technical viability, and lifecycle implications of military requirements and proposed solutions. Furthermore, the NOR facilitates resource-informed political decision-making.

The NOR Air and Space Capabilities (ASC) Branch provides technical, financial, economic and political advice and support regarding implementation of NATO common-funded capabilities, in particular capital investments under the NATO Security Investment Programme (NSIP) and Operations & Maintenance (O&M) funded by the NATO Military Budget. The Branch ensures the delivery of Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD), NATO-wide Air Command & Control (AirC2), Joint Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (JISR) including Indications & Warning (I&W), Surveillance and Control (including NATO Airborne Early Warning & Control and Alliance Future Surveillance and Control), as well as Space capabilities.

The incumbent is a member of the ASC Branch and responsible for the development of expert advice on future Surveillance and Control systems. Within an area of responsibility, they advise the resource committees, Strategic Commanders, NATO Agencies and NATO nations by:


evaluating military requirements and associated technical solutions presented in Capability Programme Plans and Project Proposals from an investment, running cost and workforce point of view;
evaluating and reporting on requests for authorisation to implement projects and budgets required for the operation and maintenance of the implemented systems;
monitoring project implementation and accepting completed investment projects;
contributing to the development of resource policy advice.



The incumbent may be required to replace the Branch Heador other Branch colleagues during their absence.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


have a Master‚Äôs Degree or equivalent level of education in computer science, electronic engineering and/or very closely related science/engineering field, from an institute of a recognized standing ;
have 5 years of experience as system or project manager in the field of Surveillance and Control, either in procurement and implementation, or in the field of design, development and production, or in the field of operation and support through life-cycle;
be fully conversant and experienced with state-of-art principles and methodologies of programme and project management, including risk management;
demonstrate the ability to communicate both verbally and in writing complex technical and financial advice and support in a clear and understandable way to both expert and non-expert audiences;
demonstrate the ability to act with tact and diplomacy in a multinational environment where decision-making occurs by reaching consensus ;
demonstrate flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and working hours, when necessary;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù) in one; II (‚ÄúElementary‚Äù) in the other ;



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


working experience in complex multinational environments where various interests are at stake;
knowledge of National funding or NATO‚Äôs common-funding processes and procedures;
knowledge and/or experience in the field of JISR, IAMD, AirC2, I&W or Space systems and principles;
proven qualification / certification in the fields of Programme management and/or Project management;
extensive knowledge of modern engineering techniques related to various subjects impacting military capabilities;
understanding and/or knowledge of NATO military concepts and principles;
the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and possess strong teamwork skills;
a higher level of the second NATO official language.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Expertise Development

Provide expert advice to stakeholders in committees, national delegations and authorities of member Nations, NATO agencies, as well to military authorities at various levels on NATO capabilities and related resource issues. Conduct technical meetings with civilian and military staff of member nations considering projects and associated engineering required by the Strategic Commanders. Advise and collaborate with other engineers and programme coordinators engaged in defining cost-effective ways of meeting military requirements. Apply engineering skills, with a good understanding of NATO‚Äôs political environment and within the wider context of NATO‚Äôs common funded activities. Present, argue and defend the assessment on initial budget estimates, costing and technical solutions before the NATO resource committees, the NATO Military Authorities (NMAs) and the NATO Agencies .

Policy Development

Contribute to policy development on NATO military common-funded resources within own area of responsibility through the provision of expert technical advice as required. Determine the impact of existing policies and architectures on the design and implementation of NATO projects. Produce and present concise and comprehensive reports on the submitted military requirement, proposed technical solution, implementation plans and resource estimates, to the NATO resource and other committees.

Project Management

Prepare and present reports to the Resource Policy and Planning Board (RPPB) for capability programme planning approval, in their responsibility for projects and programmes. Prepare and present advice concerning project proposals and associated requests to the Investment Committee (IC) or the Budget Committee (BC) for services. Determine the direction of assigned projects/programs, identify risks and suggest possible solutions. Provide technical advice and liaison with NATO Military Authorities, NATO Agencies and host nations for NATO projects. Act as a Chairperson of Joint Final Inspection and Formal Acceptance Teams and prepare reports, which recommend acceptance. Liaise with the Strategic Commanders for the preparation and screening of initial budget estimates for the Operation and Maintenance of relevant systems. Prepare and present reports on budgetary issues related to these systems to the BC.

Financial Management

Review costed project proposals and initial budget estimates, screen the submissions and requests for funds for compliance with NATO policy. Monitor and report on the funding profiles and expenditures profiles of projects/systems or groups of projects/systems at all stages during their life cycle. Utilise the NATO Common Funded Integrated Resource Information System (CIRIS) or its successor.

Knowledge Management

Contribute to knowledge management through systems and processes with relevant technical and project/system management expertise on projects funded by NATO. Determine that the content of knowledge management systems is relevant and accessible to users.

Representation of the Organization

Contribute to NATO representation by developing and communicating information supportive of NATO‚Äôs interests. Act as a Chairperson of various technical meetings representing the NOR. Represent NATO as a technical expert and advisor during site visits and inspections as well as in other circumstances linked to the assessment, design or implementation of NATO funded projects and programmes. Conduct and lead meetings on NATO common-funded projects with authority, involving different stakeholders from NATO member nations, NATO Military Authorities and NATO Agencies, at different work and management levels.

Stakeholder Management

Determine how best to enhance and develop a network of key stakeholders. Assess, manage and consolidate the network within the broader interests of the NOR. Provide options for effective issue management through monitoring and analysis of current affairs. Proactively develop a network of stakeholders to ensure that the resource-impact of decisions is considered as early as possible. Assist, as directed, in the formulation of technical architectures and standards, which guide Alliance member nations and NMAs .

Perform any other related duty as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent reports to the Branch Head ASC and must be able to operate with diplomacy and tact in a multinational environment where decision-making occurs by reaching consensus among the NATO Member Nations and where various different, also national industrial, interests are at stake. The incumbent participates in, leads and advises during discussions with national Delegations and Authorities of member countries. They also liaise with appropriate NATO Agencies, NATO Military Authorities and national Authorities at Ministries of Defence and other members of the International Staff.

Direct reports: N/A

Indirect reports: N/A


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Creates own measures of excellence and improves performance;
Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships;
Change Leadership: Expresses vision for change;
Impact and Influence: Uses indirect influence;
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation;
Organizational Awareness: Understands organizational politics;
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others.



6. CONTRACT

Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel R√©gulations.

NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post.

Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:


For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment



Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate‚Äôs medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION



https://www.nato.int/structur/recruit/2025/encoding-vacancies.pdf

However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel R√©gulations.

NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post.

Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.

  • USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS


Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

  • For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
  • For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment


Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate‚Äôs medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

  • ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


https://www.nato.int/structur/recruit/2025/encoding-vacancies.pdf

Title: Freelance BI Consultant
Description:
Are you an experienced Freelance BI Consultant who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




For our client in Brussels we are looking for a Freelance BI Consultant for a longterm project.




Analysis & Design: Translate business needs into technical specifications and design data architectures using tools like Open API and Azure. Comfortable designing technical architectures for data projects.




Development & Integration: Build secure, high-performance ETL pipelines with Azure Data Factory, connect heterogeneous data sources, and integrate systems using Python, MySQL, and GIT. Experience with Azure DevOps and automated data pipelines.




Delivery & Documentation: Deliver ready-to-use datasets for Power BI dashboards and KPIs. Document processes clearly using tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, or Notion.




Quality & Maintenance: Ensure data quality through testing, filtering, and profiling. Maintain and evolve BI, Datalake, and Data Warehouse platforms. Familiar with data quality concepts and production pipeline maintenance.




Continuous Improvement & Languages: Continuously refine processes and expand expertise in Business Intelligence. Languages: French (native/bilingual), English (full professional fluency), Dutch (nice to have). Experience in the public sector is a plus.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge, we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional.




Throughout the years we built long-lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.

We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result-driven, and do you have a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcoming you to the world of Brainbridge!

Show more

Title: IT Support Analyst
Description:
We are one of the largest international law firms in the world. With over 30 offices across the globe, we strive to exceed the expectations of our clients, providing them with the highest-quality advice and legal insight, which combines the firm‚Äôs global standards with in-depth local expertise.



Our firm, work and people span jurisdictions, cultures, and languages. We offer our clients a truly international perspective. We believe every career should be rewarding and stimulating - full of opportunities to learn, thrive, and grow. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre so proud of our inclusive, friendly, and team-based approach to work.



Our one firm global strategy is focused on targeted growth led by the needs of our core clients, those who we can best support with the breadth and depth of Clifford Chance expertise, across the sectors and geographies, which matter most to them.



You‚Äôll find our clients in commercial and industrial sectors, the financial investor community, governments, regulators, trade bodies, and not-for-profit organisations. But no matter who they are or why they‚Äôve reached out to us, we provide a world-class service every step of the way. And that‚Äôs possible thanks to the entrepreneurial spirit and conscientious approach to work that you‚Äôll find across all of our teams.



Whichever area of the business you join, you‚Äôll become an integral part of an innovative, diverse and ambitious team of people. Clifford Chance is a place where the brightest minds and the best of colleagues meet.









Job Description



The Brussels' office of Clifford Chance is currently looking to recruit an IT Support Analyst.



Technology underpins our ability to deliver legal services to our clients. It allows our lawyers to work more efficiently, to ever more demanding deadlines, with higher accuracy, in closer collaboration with our clients, and across a range of locations and devices.



The role of IT Support Analyst is a challenging opportunity where you will be able to apply your knowledge and put this into practice with the benefit of resources from a well-established, globally dispersed team. Maximising the potential and adoption of technology is a priority for Clifford Chance as it plays a critical role not only in how our people work but also in ensuring we can deliver our client strategy.



As technology moves from back office efficiency to being more integrated into the core delivery of client service, our teams are developing beyond just solving problems and arise to being more innovative and forward thinking. They are increasingly helping lawyers to better understand the possibility of technology and to maximise the impact of what we do through technology delivery.









Qualifications



Fluency in spoken and written English is a pre-requisite, as well as fluency in French.



Experience of performing an IT training/functional support role in the legal sector or in a similar professional services type organisation is an advantage.



Experience of delivering Microsoft Office and iManage DMS related support/training.



Any experience with the range of document production, management and tools in the legal sector is a plus.



Strong appreciation of cyber security best practices.



Good understanding (and experience) of using templates and business standard documents.



Knowledge of Apple and iOS, and Android is an asset.



Experience in building and profiling desktops and laptops.



Experience supporting Wi-Fi, Cisco telephony, secure/follow me printing solutions is an advantage.



Hands-on experience in supporting mobile devices and Video Conferencing systems.



Good knowledge of Virtual Desktop Technologies will be an advantage.



Highly professional individual who can thrive in a challenging and demanding working environment - the role holder will be a critical factor in helping users engage better with existing and new technology in an environment where the users are typically under high pressure.



Personal passion and high level of curiosity in keeping abreast of developments in technology and understanding how it works.



Strong problem-solving skills, solution-oriented and logical, able to dissect problems and processes and apply pragmatic approaches to solving them.



Willingness to take ownership and show initiative to achieve results.



Resilience and self-motivation ‚Äì able to face and overcome setbacks.



Ability to engage in a consultative manner with staff to identify pain points and recommend tools to resolve.



Service orientation with strong interpersonal, communication, influencing and leadership skills



Ability to work with a multi-cultural regional team and to interact with global teams.



Strong communication skills - you will be comfortable communicating at all levels, listening and adjusting to your audience's needs, clearly explaining theoretical concepts, and getting buy-in and confirming clarification at every step.









Additional Information



Who you will work with



As the sole IT Support Analyst in the Brussels office, you will independently manage IT support tasks and you will work in a team managing IT support tasks and serve as one of the many points of contact for IT-related issues. While you will be part of the broader European IT team and have access to regional and global support, your day-to-day operations will require a high degree of autonomy and self-reliance.



Whilst Brussels based and focused, you will be part of the wider network of European offices, working in close collaboration with your colleagues in Luxembourg and Amsterdam.



You will help to ensure consistency of functional support in your office. To that end, some international support and travel might occur, although expected very limited.



Our Technology team provides customer support in every office. It also operates over several global hubs, with service and infrastructure hubs in London, Frankfurt, Warsaw, Hong Kong, New York and two Centres of Excellence in India. You will be closely aligned to the local business but will also become part of the regional and global network.



Our team is a collection of specialists with deep domain expertise across the full spectrum of technology, all of which are key to our work. The rich wealth of knowledge and deep functional expertise that is present within the global teams as a result means there is always someone who can help you.







What you will be responsible for



The IT Support Analyst is responsible at local level for ensuring that a comprehensive IT support service is provided to the partners, lawyers and business professionals, through proactive, professional and courteous customer request and incident handling. This position is also responsible for working closely with the users to educate them on the technologies deployed within the office and on the desktop, with the aim of improving efficiencies and productivities.



The IT Support Analyst acts as a power user of both our Core Technology applications and Legal Technology application toolset both in usability and understanding of product specifications and necessary configurations for varying legal uses and applications.



The IT Support Analyst understands and is motivated to look beyond the obvious technical problem, conducts research, documents results and shows an ability to analyze and draw meaningful conclusions from information gathered.



The IT Support Analyst ensures the knowledge transfer of experiences with adoption, use and requirements of Core Technology applications and the Legal Technology toolset to others on the team to enable scalability of support.



You will be responsible for delivering quality and efficient functional support to all users in Clifford Chance's Brussels office. Support will be provided via a number of channels (e-learning, floorwalking, 1-2-1 desk-side visits, etc.) to optimise the resources and minimise the impact on fee earners' time.







What you will do



Functional Support



You will provide sound advice and assistance with the handling of complex incidents and requests, working with other resolution teams when necessary. Where calls need to be escalated to another team, you will ensure that ownership has been transferred.



You will provide desktop hardware (including printers) and software support including remote services (e.g. RAS/VPN, Token & secure ID, mobile devices, etc.)



You will be responsible for supporting the technologies inside the client and internal meeting rooms including the video conferencing event testing and setup.



You will ensure that you continue to adapt to the ever-changing face of technology, with users having services on many different hardware and software platforms.



Infrastructure Support



You will assist the Global and Regional Infrastructure team to test and rollout new Infrastructure equipment in the local office.



You will provide weekend or out of hours support (on site or remotely) and testing after system changes performed by the Infrastructure Team, the Global Shared Service Centre, or the vendor if necessary.



You will coordinate with the Infrastructure team and the local vendors for any infrastructure hardware issues in the local office.



Project Support



You will work with the Regional Technology Managers and Implementation Manager on all phases for projects coming into the local office, including pilot testing, problem reporting, follow up with issues, support during the project rollout, and attend necessary training if needed.



Client Focus



You will maximise face-to-face contact with the user in any interaction, whilst being mindful of the fact that we are working with typically time-starved users.



You will provide a high degree of initiative and a willingness to accept ownership of tasks, keeping the client's interests at the forefront of all activity.



You will ensure that any issues are dealt with promptly and remediated appropriately.



You will proactively engage with fee earners and business professionals to educate them on how to take advantage of the various technology tools and services available to them with the aim of improving efficiencies and productivity.



You will demonstrate a proactive focus on constantly improving the overall user experience with IT.



You will contribute to the broader regional IT team by generating new ideas and ways to improve the service delivered by IT.



Procurement



You will assist with the management of the relationship with local vendors.



You will maintain and manage hardware assets in the office.



You will provide input to prepare the local IT budget and assist in the planning, implementing and managing of a business-aligned IT budget.







Equal opportunities



At Clifford Chance we understand that our true asset is our people. Inclusion is good for our team and their families, our firm and society.



We are committed to treating all employees and applicants fairly and equally regardless of their gender, gender identity and expression, marital or civil partnership status, race, colour, national or ethnic origin, social or economic background, disability, religious belief, sexual orientation, or age. This applies to recruitment and selection, terms and conditions of employment including pay, promotion, training, transfer and every other aspect of employment.



Our goal is to deliver an equality of opportunity, an equality of aspiration and an equality of experience to everyone who works in our firm. Find out more here.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Tasks

Lead and deliver complex client assignments, ensuring quality assurance and guiding consultants in their daily tasks
Assist clients in addressing their most pressing data and regulatory challenges, including credit, risk, finance, client, and ESG regulations
Analyze data to derive valuable insights and take ownership of implementing solutions while measuring their effectiveness in partnership with the client
Build and nurture strong client relationships, including training junior consultants and engaging with senior client management
Facilitate post-delivery meetings to assess project value and performance, ensuring continual client satisfaction
Lead proposal processes end-to-end and ensure successful project completion
Support Senior Managers and contribute to the development of practice value propositions and directors during key meetings




Benefits

Dynamic and challenging environment to start your career in Financial Services
Opportunity to work on a wide range of complex and rewarding projects for prestigious clients within the banking industry
We promote internal knowledge sharing, a dedicated Risk and Regulatory Academy, external courses and professional certification programs (e.g., FRM, PRM)
We invest in the development and progression of our people to maximise their potential
We are a non-hierarchical organisation and promote openness, teamwork and knowledge sharing within the firm and the Reply Group
We offer a competitive base salary alongside a benefits package including bonuses to reward performance




Qualifications‚Äã

At least 3 years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst
Masters Degree or equivalent in Finance, Economics, Business Management, Business Engineering or other relevant field of studies
Fluent in English as well as able to speak either Dutch or French
You have advanced proficiency in SQL and/or Python
You possess solid expertise in data manipulation, analysis, cleansing, extraction, transformation, loading, and visualization techniques
You have experience working with data tools such as Collibra, Mega Hopex, MicroStrategy, Dataiku, Qlik, Power BI, and Tableau
You have an interest in AI and a strong understanding of data-related concepts such as data quality, metadata, and Master Data Management







About Avantage Reply

Avantage Reply, part of the Reply Group, specialises in Financial Services consulting with a focus on Governance, Risk and Finance Transformation, Treasury and Capital, Quantitative Modelling, Compliance and Regulatory Advisory. With offices across Europe, we count some of the world‚Äôs most significant financial groups among our clients, including in Investment, Retail and Commercial Banking, Custodian Banking, Insurance and Investment Management.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 19 markets. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents.

Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?

Let's start with the role

We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst to join our fast-growing BI & Analytics team and contribute to the expansion of our Kaizen Gaming functions during an exciting scale-up data journey.

As a Data Analyst you will:

  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders, proactively providing data analyses and insights to the function;
  • Interpret KPIs with a clear understanding on results vs. expected targets;
  • Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders enabling them to make better-informed business decisions;
  • Continuously assess and refine existing metrics and KPIs and work closely with the rest of Business Intelligence (BI) to develop new ones that drive business growth;
  • Work closely with the rest of BI team to ensure alignment, adopt best practices in data visualization, and facilitate seamless information flow from the hub to the spoke and vice versa;
  • Contribute to fostering a strong data-driven culture across the organization;
  • Design and develop data intelligence solutions, including analysis, reporting and dashboards of key metrics and KPIs.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or similar;
  • Experience in a reporting, statistical or quantitative role‚Äîexperience in the gaming industry would be considered a plus;
  • Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize workload;
  • Exceptional data storytelling skills and the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience;
  • Strategic thinker with the ability to collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders;
  • High drive, can-do attitude, proactive, and adaptable to changing business demands;
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, as well as strong skills in MS-Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, v-lookups);
  • Working experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered a plus (or other dashboarding tools such as Tableau);
  • Working experience with Python would also be considered a plus (especially Pandas, Numpy, and other relevant libraries for data analysis);
  • Fluent in English.

At Kaizen Gaming, we value innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you.

Kaizen Gaming Perks

  • üïë Hybrid way of working
  • üèÉ A buddy will support you with your onboarding
  • üí∏ Competitive pay and bonus scheme
  • üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Private health insurance for you and your family
  • üí∞ Monthly meal allowance
  • ‚≠êDevelopmental 360¬∞ feedback framework
  • üìö Unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training

Recruitment Privacy Notice

Regarding the data you share with us, you may find and read our recruitment privacy notice here.

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation,or age.

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities


Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ICE. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex financial datasets, identifying trends, and overseeing the collection and maintenance of critical data assets.

This role demands analytical abilities, proficiency with leading data analysis tools, and strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be tasked with Investments Funds and Warrants-Certificates reference data analysis, data management and standardization, sources research in order to set up wide financial reference datasets in proprietary systems.

Additionally, the candidate will be asked to establish and nurture relationships with Investments Funds and Warrant-Certificates issuers across Europe and, when required, in non-European regions. Among the duties there is the setup of issuing documents flows (KIDs, Factsheets, reporting and regulations Templates).

The candidate should proactively identify opportunities to optimize processes related to data entry and loading through the implementation of dedicated tools.

Furthermore, the role involves providing support to both Italian and international Clients by offering clear explanations and guidance regarding data standardization, content, frequency, and updates. The successful candidate will be instrumental in ensuring high data quality and supporting strategic business initiatives through actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze financial data.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and financial services.


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, Banking or Statistic and Data Science and related field.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial sector would be an asset.
Experience with data modeling, statistical analysis is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis software.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance in the financial industry is a plus
Fluent in Italian and English
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R (preferably knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI).
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Team Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with various departments is a must.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:


Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance


Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.

The MSXI Purpose

To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world

The MSXI Mission

To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions

The MSXI Vision

To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

Job Description

Business Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

The Role

Responsibilities

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:


Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences


Qualifications

About you

About

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:


3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
Fluent level of English


If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

What‚Äôs in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy


Competitive salary
Company laptop and phone
Lunch voucher


Working Pattern


40 hours per week
Monday ‚Äì Friday
Rome - hybrid


You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Junior Consultant Data Analyst (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Disegno di basi dati con finalit√† analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entit√†/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics;
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†;
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra;
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale;
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati;
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative;
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†

At KPMG - no secrets with big data

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


Designing databases for analytical purposes
Analyzing and integrating data sources
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling;
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad;
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.


Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements;
  • Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.

  • You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant;

Title: AML Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

AML Data Analyst Intern

AML Data Analyst Intern

Rome, Italy

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline‚Äôs merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities


Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees;
Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis;
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities; Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps;
Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.


Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:


Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law;
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R);
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills;
Excellent communication skills;
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus;
Good level of English in speaking and writing.


Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you‚Äôll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:


Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Enjoy remote work (50%).
Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).


Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you‚Äôll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
CHI SIAMO:

iQera Italia S.p.A. √® una societ√† italiana leader nel settore del Recupero Crediti, Real Estate, Due Diligence e Outsourcing di processi aziendali.

Siamo attivi nel mercato italiano degli NPL (Non Performing Loans) e UTP (Unlikely to Pay) come branch locale di iQera Group e come Servicer specializzato nella gestione integrata del credito e dei beni immobiliari.

I servizi offerti da iQera si basano su una professionalit√† maturata in oltre 30 anni di esperienza, creando un modello integrato di supporto e gestione a 360¬∞ nel settore del Credito e del Real Estate, attraverso competenze, intelligenza relazionale e un ampio utilizzo della tecnologia e dell'intelligenza artificiale.

Cerchiamo, per la nostra sede di lavoro a Roma, un Senior Data Analyst da inserire all‚Äôinterno della divisione PORTFOLIO & DATA MANAGEMENT.


COSA FARAI:

  • Gestione progetti e attivit√† di analisi di portafogli NPL;
  • Attivit√† di Underwriting su singoli posizioni o su portafogli NPL;
  • Attivit√† di PMO nelle due Diligence e Business Plan su portafogli NPL;
  • Creazione, adattamento ed esecuzione di modelli statistici di interpretazione dei dati;
  • Creazione di report e documenti con i risultati delle analisi da presentare ai clienti interni ed esterni.


I TUOI REQUISITI:

  • Laurea magistrale in discipline tecniche, preferibilmente in Data Science, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica e Scienze Statistiche;
  • Esperienza di almeno 5 anni come Data Analyst;
  • Esperienza pregressa in attivit√† di Underwriting;
  • Ottima conoscenza in ambito statistico;
  • Buona capacit√† nella modellazione dei dati;
  • Ottima conoscenza di data visualization;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei metodi di analisi dei Big Data e dei tool di analisi (Excel, R, Phyton, Sas)
  • Buon team working e problem solving, ottimo orientamento al risultato;
  • Flessibilit√† e forte motivazione;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Rappresenter√† un valore aggiunto l‚Äôesperienza maturata come Data Analyst nella valutazione di portafogli NPL



DA NOI TROVERAI:

  • ambiente di lavoro internazionale;
  • opportunit√† di crescita professionale;
  • formazione continua;
  • Contratto di lavoro subordinato, CCNL Commercio, da commisurare in base all‚Äôesperienza.


La ricerca √® rivolta a tutti i generi (L.903/77). Gli interessati possono inoltrare il proprio CV dando l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi D.Lgs.196/03.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

Ti aiuteremo a crescere in un mondo globale e connesso, portando la tua carriera dove desideri.

Unisciti a EY e contribuisci a costruire un mondo del lavoro migliore.

Cosa dicono di noi:

Questi sono i fattori pi√π influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci negli ultimi anni:

Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all‚Äôanno per ciascuna persona;

  • Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si √® vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera;
  • Salary e Benefits: con un‚Äôampia gamma di convenzioni aziendali, dalla palestra allo shopping, fino a servizi gratuiti di telemedicina e supporto psicologico;
  • Mobilit√† e opportunit√† internazionali, compresa la possibilit√† di lavorare dall‚Äôestero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta;
  • Lavoro ibrido senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.

L'opportunit√† e le tue responsabilit√†:

Come Senior Data Analyst ti occuperai di:

  • definizione dei requisiti di business;
  • identificazione dei dati pertinenti e necessari per le analisi di business;
  • determiner√† e individuer√†, collaborando con i Data Engineer, le fonti dati appropriate a soddisfare i requisiti di business, per determinare nuovi processi atti a migliorare la raccolta dei dati per l‚Äôanalisi;
  • attivit√† di profilatura, pulizia e trasformazione dei dati;
  • creazione di modelli dati scalabili ed efficienti per finalit√† di reporting.
  • analisi e visualizzazione dei dati attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo di tecnologie come data mining, data exploration, Power BI, QlikSense, per la generazione di insight che rispondano alle domande degli stakeholder di business
  • gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall‚Äôesigenza di business, alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi (storytelling dei dati)

Le skills che stiamo cercando:

  • Laurea in materie ingegneristiche o scientifiche
  • 2-4 anni di esperienza in progetti nel settore industriale, preferibilmente in societ√† di consulenza
  • Competenze di sviluppo front-end con tecnologia Power BI;
  • Buona conoscenza del linguaggio SQL ;
  • Conoscenza di PowerQuery;
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio DAX;
  • Competenze in ambito statistico;
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Conoscenza professionale della lingua italiana

Cosa ti offriamo in EY

In EY, ti aiutiamo a sviluppare competenze future e vivere esperienze di livello mondiale. Avrai la possibilit√† di crescere in un ambiente flessibile e mostrare il tuo talento in una cultura diversificata e inclusiva con team globali connessi.

Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di:

  • partecipare a progetti di ogni tipo per clienti di ogni settore;
  • accedere a + 450.000 ore di formazione erogate per accrescere le tue competenze tecniche e il tuo talento personale;
  • essere supportato/a da un Counselor nel tuo percorso professionale;
  • usufruire di una policy flessibile e della possibilit√† di lavorare dall‚Äôestero;
  • accedere a benefits e programmi di welfare aziendale diversificati.

EY promuove la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l‚Äôinclusione, valorizzando l‚Äôunicit√†, indipendentemente da et√†, genere, abilit√†, esperienza, cultura, orientamento sessuale, religione, disabilit√† e

background socioeconomico. Tutte le nostre offerte di lavoro si rivolgono allo stesso modo a persone con disabilit√†, in conformit√† con la legge italiana L. 68/99. Il nostro obiettivo √® creare un ambiente di lavoro equo e accessibile.

Per garantirti la migliore esperienza possibile durante il processo di selezione, ti chiediamo di indicarci i presidi necessari in relazione alla tua eventuale disabilit√†.

EY | Costruire un mondo del lavoro migliore

EY sta costruendo un mondo del lavoro migliore, creando nuovo valore per i clienti, le persone, la societ√† e il pianeta, rafforzando al contempo la fiducia nei mercati finanziari.

Grazie ai dati, all‚Äôintelligenza artificiale e alle tecnologie avanzate, i team di EY aiutano i clienti a plasmare il futuro con fiducia e a trovare soluzioni alle sfide pi√π urgenti di oggi e di domani.

I team di EY operano in un‚Äôampia gamma di servizi: revisione, consulenza, fiscalit√†, strategia e operazioni straordinarie. Alimentati da una profonda conoscenza dei settori, da una rete globale multidisciplinare e da un ecosistema di partner diversificato, i team EY offrono servizi in oltre 150 Paesi e territori.
